story:
We set out to give pens across the world a new purpose. We breathed life into an old design, added an executive finish, used revolutionary craftsmanship techniques, but above all...we made it defy gravity.

 Serene. Magical. Perfectly balanced. The HOVERPEN is a new take on desktop stationary.

A gorgeous, innovative design elevates the Hoverpen. Designed to amaze, the Hoverpen will take your office desktop from plain to paramount.

The Hoverpen is the world's first vertically standing, gravity-defying pen. The Hoverpen's innovative pedestal creates a magnetic field keep it perfectly balanced.

No batteries, no electronics, just pure design innovation. The Hoverpen will stand tall and elegant forever as a eye-catching centerpiece of your office desk.

Because of the Hoverpen's perfect balance, it spins frictionlessly with a gentle twist. 

The pens spinning motion is hypnotic. Take a moment to reflect as the pen rapidly turns, and let it's mesmerizing motion fill you new inspiration.

Just when the workday reaches its stressful peak. watch the Hoverpen twist, wobble, and wave, like the solo performer in a stationary ballet, and let the stress melt away.

Spice up your desk with an incredible new centerpiece. Arouse the curiosity of your friends and colleagues as they catch a glimpse of the Hoverpen's startling design.

Or simply take a moment out of your day to watch the mesmerizing motion of the Hoverpen as it spins, or break up the monotony of the workday. Let the Hoverpen spark your next big creative insight.

Or simply give it a nudge and watch it bob back and forth, like the relaxing swing of a pendulum, to hone your focus for the big task ahead.

Utility for the creator, and fidget-oriented design make the Hoverpen the ideal fit for those of us who work and play in equal measures. 

A fully magnetic cap opens up the options for trick shots and fidgeting! Just bring the cap into the pen shaft's magnetic field and *BAM* they connect, just like magic. 

The Hoverpen was designed to brighten up a dull day. Every part of the pens eight precision-cut and polished components were designed with the fidgeter in mind.

Made from top-grade free-flowing ink, the Hoverpen offers an easy-glide writing experience. A premium Swiss-made ballpoint cartridge gives everyone from artists, to engineers, to financiers the dependability they need to crush the workday. 

An incredible pen with a memorable writing experience. The Hoverpen is unlike any pen you've ever used before.

Designed for quick and easy reloads, the Hoverpen may be the last pen you'll ever buy. Compatible with any Cross brand refill ink cartridges, you won't need to depend on any specialized retailers to get a quick refill. 

The ink cartridges that come with the Hoverpen are made in Switzerland, high quality and screw-capped, meaning they're easy to remove and stay solidly fixed inside the pen shaft, no matter how vigorously you use your Hoverpen.

Out of ink? Want to change the color? We wanted the Hoverpen to be a long-lasting partner in work and in life, so you'll be able to reload it by simply buying any Cross brand refill cartridges (or similar-sized cartridge), available wherever pen products are sold. 

With an extra ink cartridge in every pack, double your creative stamina and win the day thanks to the Hoverpen's premium writing experience.

Executive design. Clean lines. Minimalism at its core. The Hoverpen's striking design will take any desk from mundane to magnificent in a heartbeat. A sturdy body of impenetrable titanium or mastercrafted aluminum means lifelong durability. The Hoverpen is finished at the same facility as Apple products - so you can count on the final product looking stunning.

Designed by creative minds, for creative minds - the Hoverpen is designed to turn heads and provoke curiosity. With a color selection to match your personal style, the Hoverpen feels at home in any hand.

The aluminum version of the Hoverpen comes with two finishes: matte or shine. Shine glimmers in the sunlight, and has been polished to perfection-matte finish vs shine finish. Matte = treated (sandblasted to make matte finish). 

Our titanium offering comes in a smudge-resistant matte finish. Each of the 8 components of this prestigious pen have each been individually sandblasted to give the pen a high-quality, executive finish. 

Because of the design and placement of the Hoverpen's balancing technology, there is a VERY low margin for error in production. In fact, there is less than 0.1mm room for error in manufacturing the pen and the pedestal. The Hoverpen is finished at the same facility as Apple products, so you can count on top-tier, lasting quality.

Using high-precision CNC machining, with a rigorous quality control process, each Hoverpen is perfectly proportioned. For the Hoverpen to perfectly balance, there is a <0.1 mm margin for error in manufacturing, so we keep a close watch on the products and make sure each lives up to the executive-level quality Shanpo is known for. 

Each piece is either sandblasted or polished to perfection - in the same process that Apple uses to manufacture its iPhones. The base of the Hoverpen (i.e., the "pedestal") is made of high density zinc, and is coated with a rubber bottom so it stays firmly planted on your desk.

 

 

The Hoverpen combines the beauty of minimalist design, with the whimsy of meditative distraction. Mastercrafted metalwork and an obsession with precision makes the Hoverpen the next conversation starter in the office.

Work, home, office, studio, playroom - the Hoverpen captures attention and turns heads wherever it stands.

 

Give your Hoverpen a permanent home on a walnut wood display base. Crafted from real walnut wood, the accent base add-on elevates your new desktop head-turner to the next level. 

Precisely carved to perfectly fit the Hoverpen and other accessories, the walnut wood accent base add a classy touch to the Hoverpen's minimalist design. The bevel of the accent base offers the convenience of having stationary and other items (including the Hoverpen notebook below) within easy reach. 

 

 

Inspired by it's magnetic sibling, the Hoverpen, our premier notebook features a fully magnetic clasp, premium, smooth-gliding paper, and matching brand aesthetic - rest in the inner groove of the accent base to complete your Hoverpen package.

 

 

 

Custom Engraving

Make Hoverpen part of your workplace by getting your sets custom engraved with your company name, motto, or witticism. Custom engraved caps are available for bulk orders (40x Hoverpen pledges) only. Up to 16 characters can be engraved.

 

Once you've completed the order, get in touch with us and we can make arrangements for your own, personally engraved Hoverpen!

 

 

 

 

We've already made over 50 samples of Hoverpen - so we are confident the fulfillment and manufacturing of the project will be a relatively smooth ride. However, we'll keep our backers informed 100% of the way!

Shanpo has been designing creative products for over 5 years. Our products are available in online stores across the world. Our previous Kickstarter, an adorable animal-themed speaker is a testament to our high-quality craftsmanship and attention to detail. Our team of 5 creatives stands by the quality of the Hoverpen, at the intersection of executive craftsmanship, desktop novelty and writing perfection.

A sturdy body of impenetrable titanium or mastercrafted aluminum means lifelong durability. The Hoverpen is finished at the same facility as Apple products - so you can count on the final product looking stunning.Designed by creative minds, for creative minds - the Hoverpen is designed to turn heads and provoke curiosity. With a color selection to match your personal style, the Hoverpen feels at home in any hand.The aluminum version of the Hoverpen comes with two finishes: matte or shine. Shine glimmers in the sunlight, and has been polished to perfection-matte finish vs shine finish. Matte = treated (sandblasted to make matte finish). Our titanium offering comes in a smudge-resistant matte finish. Each of the 8 components of this prestigious pen have each been individually sandblasted to give the pen a high-quality, executive finish. Because of the design and placement of the Hoverpen's balancing technology, there is a VERY low margin for error in production. In fact, there is less than 0.1mm room for error in manufacturing the pen and the pedestal. The Hoverpen is finished at the same facility as Apple products, so you can count on top-tier, lasting quality.Using high-precision CNC machining, with a rigorous quality control process, each Hoverpen is perfectly proportioned. For the Hoverpen to perfectly balance, there is a <0.1 mm margin for error in manufacturing, so we keep a close watch on the products and make sure each lives up to the executive-level quality Shanpo is known for. Each piece is either sandblasted or polished to perfection - in the same process that Apple uses to manufacture its iPhones. The base of the Hoverpen (i.e., the "pedestal") is made of high density zinc, and is coated with a rubber bottom so it stays firmly planted on your desk.  The Hoverpen combines the beauty of minimalist design, with the whimsy of meditative distraction. Mastercrafted metalwork and an obsession with precision makes the Hoverpen the next conversation starter in the office.Work, home, office, studio, playroom - the Hoverpen captures attention and turns heads wherever it stands. Give your Hoverpen a permanent home on a walnut wood display base. Crafted from real walnut wood, the accent base add-on elevates your new desktop head-turner to the next level. Precisely carved to perfectly fit the Hoverpen and other accessories, the walnut wood accent base add a classy touch to the Hoverpen's minimalist design. The bevel of the accent base offers the convenience of having stationary and other items (including the Hoverpen notebook below) within easy reach.   Inspired by it's magnetic sibling, the Hoverpen, our premier notebook features a fully magnetic clasp, premium, smooth-gliding paper, and matching brand aesthetic - rest in the inner groove of the accent base to complete your Hoverpen package.      Custom EngravingMake Hoverpen part of your workplace by getting your sets custom engraved with your company name, motto, or witticism. Custom engraved caps are available for bulk orders (40x Hoverpen pledges) only. Up to 16 characters can be engraved. Once you've completed the order, get in touch with us and we can make arrangements for your own, personally engraved Hoverpen!    We've already made over 50 samples of Hoverpen - so we are confident the fulfillment and manufacturing of the project will be a relatively smooth ride. However, we'll keep our backers informed 100% of the way!Shanpo has been designing creative products for over 5 years. Our products are available in online stores across the world. Our previous Kickstarter, an adorable animal-themed speaker is a testament to our high-quality craftsmanship and attention to detail. Our team of 5 creatives stands by the quality of the Hoverpen, at the intersection of executive craftsmanship, desktop novelty and writing perfection.       Get Your Project Funded Today!

story:
How Does C’est Vrai Work?

C’est Vrai is French for, "It's true," a reference to the reliably-sourced, fact-based reporting function of the web app. At the time of launch, C'est Vrai will have up to 5 million database entries comprised of information taken from publicly-available sources, which have been processed for names, roles, and relationship information. 

Users will be able to search the database for information related to specific individuals or entities, as well as discover relationships between two such entities - regardless of the number of degrees of separation between them.  This function will enable reporters who use the app to save time on the research aspect of investigative reporting.  Here’s how it works:


Upon its completion, C’est Vrai will be available by subscription and serve as the backbone for a new investigative journalism worker cooperative called Progress New York.  Given the contraction of the newspaper industry and closure of Gothamist and DNA Info New York, the founding of this investigative journalism cooperative will ensure that the robust role of the “Fourth Estate” continues in New York.
 

Timeline: What’s Next?

  • Phase 1 - Campaign launched: Funds raised will help developers work toward the completion of C’est Vrai.
  • Phase 2 - Campaign complete: C’est Vrai Beta goes live in March.  Subscriptions to the app and newsletter become available to contributors (depending on the amount given).
  • Phase 3 - C’est Vrai complete.  At this time, the research tool of C’est Vrai will be publicly-available via subscription.  Revenue will help build out the investigative journalism cooperative of Progress New York.

After the completion of these phases, journalists, researchers, and others will be able to access C’est Vrai’s custom-built and maintained database of reliably sourced information.  Journalism is moving toward the usage of computer-assisted reporting tools, and C’est Vrai was created to rival other information products, but at a much more affordable rate.

Lastly, we will be putting out an exclusive weekly newsletter to contributors that will provide a curated selection of news articles based on the insight of Progress New York reporters.

The Team: Progress New York

Louis Flores, editor of Progress New York, is an activist and blogger who turned to citizen journalism after realizing the corporate-owned media would not fully report the truth about the corruptive role of money in politics. He began reporting on New York City politics after term limits were overturned for municipal politicians. His activism and blogs have been covered by The New York Times, The Advocate, The New York Daily News, and Têtu.

Louis Flores’ track record with citizen journalism has been impressive.  He has used an existing news website, Progress Queens, as a vehicle to file open records requests with municipal, state, and federal agencies.  Progress Queens has recorded over 100,000 page views, impactful for being an outlet for citizen journalism.  

Reports published by Progress Queens with the assistance of C’est Vrai have have attracted significant attention from “important eyeballs,” such as officials with the New York City Department of Investigation, the New York City Campaign Finance Board, the New York State Attorney General’s Office, the U.S. Department of Justice, and other law enforcement agencies.

Also part of this project is Michael Synan, website developer, data analyst, and technologist. He has a Master’s Degree in Urban Studies from Hunter College and has been involved in political work related to gentrification, particularly the influence of corporate real estate on land use.

The cooperative includes one additional member, and is actively recruiting other potential partners.

Risks & Challenges

If this crowdfunding campaign is not successful, the completion of C'est Vrai may not be achieved in time for the launch of our cooperative.  Consequently, the developers will have to seek private investors or backers to fund the completion of C'est Vrai. Seeking private backers may involve loans or compromising the financial feasibility of an investigative journalism cooperative.  

The developers behind C'est Vrai are counting on support from the news media, big data, and worker cooperative communities to spread the word about this crowdfunding campaign so that the funding goal can be achieved.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a donation, there are ways you can help this crowdfunding campaign reach its goal:

  • Ask your friends and families to share the link to this crowdfunding campaign and to explain what is at stake for them if we can complete the development of C'est Vrai.
  • Share this link on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn. Please know you can use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

Thank you so much for your support.

story:
Most people take paper for granted. Paper is just... paper after all! We can write on it, print on it, wrap our food and products. But that's it, right? Most people think paper is weightless and, of course, weak. 

 

 

But we made g.flow stone Laptop Stand in a very different way. A little slower, but a sustainable and innovative way! And for those who think paper is weak and fragile, we found the perfect solution to prove this wrong – folding.

 

 

The fascinating geometric folding structure makes a sheet of paper incredibly sturdy. g.flow stone is unbelievably light but it can hold an object that is around 100 times heavier than itself!

 

 

 

 

  As beautiful as before, stronger than ever. We've upgraded our signature laptop stand into g.flow stone. Now it is waterproof and more resistant to wear and tear while maintaining what's most important to us: sustainability & social impact.

 

 

 

 

 

g.flow stone is the world’s lightest and most portable laptop stand, weighing only 90 grams (3 oz). A unique design idea from grape lab sustainable design lab, it is entirely made by folding a single sheet of 100% recycled paper.

 

 

 

 

 

 g.flow stone is made of Stone Paper, a magical mixture of stone waste deriving from the mining industry. It's just like regular paper, 100% recycled, easily recyclable, and environmentally friendly. But many times more resistant to wear and tear and stronger than ever.

 

 

 

 

 

g.flow stone is completely waterproof. Could you ever imagine a piece of paper being waterproof without any type of coating? This is how amazing our Stone Paper is. Plus, it brings some peace to your work life. Dropped your coffee cup or water tumbler? No worries, just wipe it and you're good to go. An accident-free environment. Decided you should go work on the beach? Keep your computer safe from sand and water splash!

 

 

 

 

 

Source: L. Indriati, M. A. Nugraha, and Y. S. Perng, (2020)."Stone paper, an eco-friendly and free-tree paper" American Institute of Physics conference.

 

This is why g.flow stone is different. 

We strive to research every material we decide to use in our products. Our Stone Paper is made of a mixture of 80% limestone powder, a waste material that comes from the mining process of industrial limestone.

 

 

We make g.flow stone from a just single sheet of Stone Paper. No glues. No chemical coatings. No waste. The biggest difference lies here. We don't take from nature to create g.flow, we use the scraps from industry and reinvent them. Using minimum resources, we've designed a ready-to-use and ready-to-recycle laptop stand. It is a closed-loop manufacturing process.

 

 

The other 20% of Stone Paper is made of recycled plastic material. The HDPE plastic used to manufacture g.flow comes entirely from recycled sources. We stop these materials from becoming waste in the first place by collecting and transforming them. It’s our goal to prevent plastic waste from keep causing a harmful impact, polluting our oceans and nature. 

 

 

 

Sources: Environmental Paper Network (c.environmentalpaper.org), Interference UK (inference.org.uk)

 

 

 

 

 

  g.flow Stone is carefully made by folding one single sheet of paper, without any glues or chemical coatings. It is an analog process that meets the high-quality digital precision while focusing on using minimal resources and green technology. 

 

 

 

 

 

It doesn't matter where your office is, g.flow is lightweight and ready to use. Slide it out of its case and say good-bye to slouching, neck and wrist pain, device overheating. Welcome proper airflow, perfect angles for typing and viewing, and a paper-light stand with waterproof quality! Digital nomad workstation ready!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

step 1: Take if out of the case. Hold it by the sides.

 

step 2: Stretch it out to around 30 cm (12 inches) to securely place your device on it.

 

step 3: Place your device. Make sure it is attached to the front holder.

 

step 4: That's it! :) Enjoy using your devices comfortably.

 

 

 

g.flow stone Basic: Gray

 

g.flow stone Basic: Lavender

 

g.flow stone Art Edition: Rainbow Heart

 

 

 

 

 

 

I really like to bring pixels into the material world. They were not meant for that purpose. They are artifacts of former technical limitations, today representatives of a so-called "Golden age of Videogaming."

I like to play with traditional art techniques and how to twist them to let them become pixelated. And thus, creating something new, because the real world and its materials are not as perfect as the math behind pixels. It's my way of questioning these digitally dominant times. 

 

 

 

 

Artists Hyun-woo Kim and Kyung-wook Bae during grape lab's workshop

 

The Art Edition Project is a collaboration with various artists from around the world. It is one of grape lab's experiments for creating a sustainable symbiotic economic system while breaking the boundaries between disabled and non-disabled artwork.

 

 

Our goal is to continue working with minorities and a diverse community, giving them opportunities for interaction and expression. We keep working with these artists to give them visibility and to help them achieve financial stability through a profit-sharing platform.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Click the image to download our press kit

 

 

 

While g.flow stone is our latest creation, during the past four years we have been developing many different paper-based unique products.  We consider ourselves as Folding Masters, each member of our team can fold g.flow in the blink of an eye! 

 

 

You might also remember us already. That's right, we were on Kickstarter some days ago with the first launch of g.flow stone Laptop Stand. Such a successful campaign! 

Thank you, dear backers, you're awesome!

 

 

Couldn't back it at that time? This is the time! Go grab your g.flow stone!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Alice Kim, grape lab's founder & art director

 

Hi there! Alice here.

Before creating grape lab, I worked as a designer in the broadcasting and IT industry for over ten years, and I had been passively contemplating the social value of design. Then I started to wonder “Is there a way to make design help someone other than just being a pretty, well-selling material?” This had been bugging me in my mind for a while but there were actually few chances for me to directly do any experiments while keeping with my busy office worker life. That's when I decided to quit, to follow what I believed, and to help to build the world I wanted to see.

 

 

 

While doing my Master’s Degree in Sustainable Design in the UK, I wrote a thesis called “The Bunch of Grapes”. You see, the grapes do not grow alone, but they always grow with another cluster next to them. Our society is getting more and more competitive, and as a result, we’re creating wider gaps and worse problems of inequality. 

 

 

We need a growing-together structure in which small organizations or individuals connect without harming each other, just like a bunch of grapes. This ideal formation inspired me, so I wish for a circular economy system based on local small businesses in marginal areas following this theory. That's how grape lab came to life. 

 

 

 

 We are a sustainable design lab doing a variety of experiments to solve environmental and social issues from a design point of view.

 

 

Using analog and green technologies, we are going against the flow of the high-tech era, taking a different approach to solving the world’s urgent issues. We focus mainly on wasted resources and vulnerable people in marginal areas of our society.

 

 

 

Lifecycle matters. 

More important than just focusing on creating a unique product, we understand all the processes behind it. 

We carefully think about every step of our product’s lifecycle and its connection to the environment–from production to its disposal. Continually searching for the cleanest sources, using minimum resources, green technology, and eliminating all unnecessary elements is our design goal.

 

 

 

Receive and give back. 

Society is an important part of our environment. As a social venture, our mission is to build a more collaborative world. 

People with intellectual disabilities are a vital part of our society’s diversity and our team–their talents give life to our products. We help struggling minorities to achieve financial stability through employment and artists with disabilities to gain more visibility through a profit-sharing system.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

We have become masters of origami folding and preparing g.flow is a common task to us. Our manufacturing line is ready and set to receive our Kickstarter production. We have printed many similar products before and we are prepared to work around most situations.

If things go really wrong, our biggest risk is to have to re-print, which might cause some delay to the production and shipping. Due to the current world situation regarding COVID-19, there might be changes to the shipping costs to certain places and delays in the delivery that go beyond us.

story:
Buy.Sell.Trade.Share Veggies! New Community App to share locally, home grown sustainable food and make money along the way!

FEATURED PERK: Come to San Diego and hang out with people who love to grow veggies and go to the beach of course. :-)


Be part of the new food revolution.....

Hi, I'm Matt creator of Veggiesmile and one of those guys who likes to grow his own food in the garden. 

Putting a seed in the ground and then watching it grow is an awesome thing. But being an amateur at it I didn't realize how such a small space can produce a huge amount of food! That's good and you end up sharing your food with neighbors. The more I grew the further I spread the food and then I found people 1 block, 2 blocks and 3 blocks away that were prepared to trade lemons for Kale and Apples for Cucumbers. You get the idea....

I realized that if only everyone grew a little food, even in pots or had some land to share we could reduce the HUGE food waste that is happening in the world and little by little we could start to create a sustainable growing community.

AND MAYBE WE CAN REDUCE THE 1.5 BILLION TONS OF WASTED FOOD EACH YEAR GLOBALLY....

1/3 of food produced in the world goes to waste and millions of people are starving in this world. We all have land and yards we could use to grow more food  and share in the fruits of of labor.


That's where the idea of the Veggiesmile website and app was born. I wanted an easy to use app that would connect me with people locally who wanted to buy.sell.trade.share home grown food.

Help grow this seed into something sustainable...

I need some money to help get this thing into production...

$15,000 would get the website finished, the Android and IPhone app finished and out to market.

I have a proof of concept made and developers ready but I need some money to push this thing forward and make it happen. The money will be spent on:

  • $5K to finish the website
  • $8K for a cross platform app
  • $2K for marketing on veggie/food websites

What would this do?

Well it would be amazing to know that this app is connecting people, bringing them together in the community to buy.sell.trade.share home grown food. Just like the old days!

But on a serious note this is a beautiful way to bring people together, to grow food, to share and talk and also to reduce to massive waste we have all over the world.

Hope you can help!

Cheers

Matt
story_txt:
Buy.Sell.Trade.Share Veggies! New Community App to share locally, home grown sustainable food and make money along the way!
FEATURED PERK: Come to San Diego and hang out with people who love to grow veggies and go to the beach of course. :-)




Be part of the new food revolution..... Hi, I'm Matt creator of Veggiesmile and one of those guys who likes to grow his own food in the garden. 
Putting a seed in the ground and then watching it grow is an awesome thing. But being an amateur at it I didn't realize how such a small space can produce a huge amount of food! That's good and you end up sharing your food with neighbors. The more I grew the further I spread the food and then I found people 1 block, 2 blocks and 3 blocks away that were prepared to trade lemons for Kale and Apples for Cucumbers. You get the idea....

I realized that if only everyone grew a little food, even in pots or had some land to share we could reduce the HUGE food waste that is happening in the world and little by little we could start to create a sustainable growing community.
AND MAYBE WE CAN REDUCE THE 1.5 BILLION TONS OF WASTED FOOD EACH YEAR GLOBALLY....

1/3 of food produced in the world goes to waste and millions of people are starving in this world. We all have land and yards we could use to grow more food  and share in the fruits of of labor.

That's where the idea of the Veggiesmile website and app was born. I wanted an easy to use app that would connect me with people locally who wanted to buy.sell.trade.share home grown food.   Help grow this seed into something sustainable... I need some money to help get this thing into production...
$15,000 would get the website finished, the Android and IPhone app finished and out to market.
I have a proof of concept made and developers ready but I need some money to push this thing forward and make it happen. The money will be spent on:


$5K to finish the website

$8K for a cross platform app

$2K for marketing on veggie/food websites


  What would this do? Well it would be amazing to know that this app is connecting people, bringing them together in the community to buy.sell.trade.share home grown food. Just like the old days!
But on a serious note this is a beautiful way to bring people together, to grow food, to share and talk and also to reduce to massive waste we have all over the world.
Hope you can help!
Cheers
Matt

story:
Silence the backseat drivers with the ability to charge and power three devices simultaneously.

In a hurry? Recharge all your USB-C essentials at ultra-fast 60W charging speeds, before making your next pit-stop.

Together, we’ve run two successful crowdfunding campaigns consisting of a handful of awesome power accessories – including our triple port 96W USB-C PD car charger.

*Amazon Review

The charger was able to successfully charge my laptop and phone all at once using usb-c. While 60W will trickle charge a laptop that has dedicated graphics, it would charge much faster if left to charge on your way to work/school. Though it will charge a 13" laptop or tablet much faster. I appreciate that it has usb-a for older devices and iPhones. It does run moderately warm, though it does not get hot. Great charger overall, truly no competitor!

 

Unlike other crowdfunding campaigns, we’re not starting from scratch here:

Flawless design, inside & out.

Our custom-built molds are ready for another production batch!

We are LIFEPOWR — a team of engineers, creatives and product developers who strive to deliver Energy Freedom. We envision, design, and build with a mission to power lives.

story:
About

Phigolf WGT Edition Mobile Golf Simulator Game combines the World Golf Tour (WGT) mobile game app with the power of Phigolf's state of the art golf club sensor to become the most exciting, true-to-sport, portable, and affordable golf simulator in the world. Hackers to scratch golfers are gonna LOVE this!

Phigolf is a mobile golf simulator system that includes a club sensor that analyzes your swing and relays the swing data to the Phigolf simulator app, allowing you to practice or play a round with friends and family. Two people can play one onother even remotely. You only need a smartphone, tablet, or an AppleTV to play Phigolf, and the screen can be mirrored onto a big screen TV for a more immersive game experience. Phigolf successfully raised funds on Kickstarter just last year.

You know World Golf Tour, or WGT. It's the #1 online video golf game on the planet! Stunningly realistic, providing access to the world’s most famous courses, WGT is free to play and more than 15 million virtual golfers across the globe are enjoying it.

As an online mobile game, WGT is clearly a ton of fun, even if you're just controlling your swings with your fingers or mouse. But what if you could physically swing a club that realistically replicates your shots on a big screen? This would take WGT to the next level of reality and enjoyment, and that's where Phigolf comes in!

Topgolf Media, the makers of WGT, and PhiNetworks are partnering up to combine software and hardware technologies to offer you a complete golf simulator package with authentic look and feel of the sport.

Now with the integration of Phigolf's sensor into WGT's system, swinging your golf club will transport you to world famous courses in WGT. Use the sensor on the included swing trainer whose shortened length is ideal for the living room or office. Or easily mount the sensor on your own club and practice while you play. You can even use Phigolf's WGT Edition Mobile Golf Simulator on the driving range or while hitting balls into a net. The Phigolf Sensor and WGT on your smartphone makes it that portable. And you'll be able to play with or against friends & family in remote locations. Play in tournaments specifically for Phigolf WGT Edition players all while earning coins and experience points through WGT.

Similar golf simulator systems can cost thousands of dollars. Phigolf WGT Edition Mobile Golf Simulator wants to change that! All passionate golfers should have access to realistic golf regardless of weather or location. Never worry about that upcoming snow storm or that unbearable heat wave again. Traveling for work all week? No problem, get in a few holes from the comfort of your hotel room.

There are so many ways to enjoy Phigolf. This simulator is rated E for EVERYONE!

Phigolf's WGT Edition Mobile Golf Simulator Game will include:

  • Phigolf WGT Edition Device
  • PhiStick Simulated Golf Club
  • WGT All-Course Pack 6-Month Subscription (Only for Kickstarter Backers)
  • Wolf Creek Golf Course Free for Life (Only for Kickstarter Backers)
  • WGT Credit and Coin Pack (Only for Kickstarter Backers)
  • Phigolf Original Simulator App All-Course Free for Life

This Kickstarter campaign will fund the integration of Phigolf's sensor with WGT's system, including hardware/firmware changes, software development and UI/UX development specific to the integration.

To thank our backers for bringing to life the most affordable true-to-sport golf simulator in the market, we are throwing in some

With Phigolf WGT Edition, you can play on some of the most beautiful golf courses around the world without leaving your living room. During this campaign, we are offering a FREE lifetime subscription to Wolf Creek Golf Course and a FREE 6-month subscription to all of the WGT courses. The regular subscription price for the WGT courses after the campaign will be $2/month or $19.99/month.

In 2013, we at the Phigolf Team sought to return the thrill of golf back into golf practice. The first prototype of this multi-platform (TV, tablet, smartphone) golf simulation took over 4 years. In the process, not only did we create our own unique swing analysis algorithm, we also built an interactive and realistic golf game from the ground up. Now Phi Golf is on the last step towards production. We very much hope that you will enjoy Phi Golf as much as we do!

The regular subscription price for the WGT courses after the campaign will be $2/month or $19.99/month.

Now Phi Golf is on the last step towards production. We very much hope that you will enjoy Phi Golf as much as we do!

story:
The Smack App.


 

Imagine, pretend if you need to ...You're sitting on the other end of a call as your friend explains that they just went back into a lousy relationship that they swore they'd never go back to.


 

You just got a bonus, you can finally pay off your debts and your sweetie says "lets go on a vacation or go out and celebrate"! (The reply will determine who needs the smack here.)


 

You have faithfully stuck to your new diet plan all week and have lost 5 pounds, and now you are at a dinner party and your accountability partner/friend says "just a little wont hurt you, you deserve it"! (Again ...The reply will determine who needs the smack here.)


 

By now you're all thinking of someone you'd just love to SMACK!


 

No, not a real one, but a virtual one! We are into kindness here, not cruelty! Something that wakes them (or you) up. Helping one to avoid that "that was really dumb" feeling, while instilling that "Its really ok to laugh at my human side" awareness!


 

Think of that someone you would love to say "I TOLD YOU SO" to, or a more parentally correct "You've been actively doing what everyone told you not to do...and it played out exactly like everyone told you it would" or the "smack" you are sending from the back of your mind as you say in your sweetest southern voice "Bless your heart".


 

We all do dumb, self-damaging things from time to time, so no one is immune from the need for this kind of 'get a grip' moment of kindness from your friends and family members who care... and who suffer almost as much brain damage watching them do dumb things as they do from actually doing them. After all we are just spiritual beings, having human experiences right?!


 

The Smack App solves none of these "human experiences". It will not make you smarter, although it may help one to learn from their mistakes a little better. It won't undo the brain damage the casual observers in your life go through every time one falls into one of these behavior patterns, but it just might make it more entertaining! Soften the blow, so to speak.

 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ykbx-yzFgBo


 

The Smack App is a video messaging app that is being developed by Dr. Martha Reed to help people realize, in a humorous, lighthearted way, when they are falling into a bad pattern in their lives and give them that remedial wake-up that can help them make a better decision in their lives. Allowing us to deliver the much needed message in a way that would otherwise be avoided as not to offend or upset anyone.


 

The Smack App will allow you to send short videos of Dr. Reed's fun-based intervention messages to help get your friends and family back on the right track when they've just done something utterly ... Well, lets just say not so smart.


 

Some of the video messages being developed are: The Dating Smack, The Diet Smack, The What Were You Thinking Smack, etc. featuring Dr. Reed delivering her best corrective interventions! Spiritual Gansta Style!


 

Our goal with the Smack App is to provide everyone with a fun and funny tool for improving their lives by giving us all that much-needed "enlightening nudge" for our most self-damaging behaviors, while creating an environment of friends and family who care enough to be that supportive partner in our lives who knows when we need a supportive kick in the rump.


 

For this app to become a reality though, we need your help. We need to cover costs for some serious video production and editing as well as for initial production costs for the app. We're asking for $15,000 of your help to make this entertaining and helpful addition to our lives a reality.


 

Each donation, no matter how small, is an important one, and we appreciate them all tremendously. That's why we have put together this assortment of rewards for every donation level. Donate at whatever level you'd like; then come back again and donate again! And again! Bring your friends, make a day of it!


 

All joking aside, though, Dr. Martha Reed is a credentialed expert in helping people break through their mental and emotional blocks to help them live the better life that they deserve. She treats all of her clients with respect and honesty so that every client expects that of themselves in the way they treat themselves and in the way they expect to be treated by others. This app extends her gentle but direct approach at getting people's attention to the patterns and issues in their lives that are causing them to stall or get stuck in familiar, painful ruts.


 

Please help Dr. Reed get this app into production and onto phones and mobile devices like yours so that we can all take those corrective actions we need to lead better lives.


 

Please note though: this project is meant to help friends and family step up and share a real, humorous, gentle but clear way of communicating when they see someone doing something they know will be regretted later. It has nothing to do with promoting violence, should never be used to bully or intimidate anyone, nor to abuse anyone. It's about empowering each other to help us make the right changes in our lives, not providing license to abuse each other more.

story:
English        Español

PrintBrush™ XDR is a first-of-its-kind color inkjet printer for smartphones. Go paperless. Go truly mobile. Save the planet.

The press has called our printer a “Magic Wand for printing” and it is now in pilot production after many years of development.

The product features PrintDreams’ RMPT™ technology which puts portable printing capability at the fingertips of smartphone users around the world. The imprints come out directly onto any type of surface with a simple wave of the hand.

 

The PrintBrush XDR is a wireless full color inkjet printer that weighs about the same as an average smartphone but can print larger imprints than its own size.

This new versatile device will change the way we think about printing because, for the first time, it is now possible to print anything in full color anywhere, on almost any surface.

The imprints are made simply by using a sweeping action, just swapping the printer’s direction from left to right or right to left, directly on any surface, be it paper, cardboard, fabrics, wood, etc.

Ordinary printer technology is significantly limited for mobile usage by the fact that printout size is directly linked to device width. RMPT overcomes this limitation by allowing larger printout sizes with smaller hardware. 

Another advantage is the ability to print directly onto a wide variety of surfaces of varying thicknesses. Mobile users can therefore pick up any paper or material available and use it as print media. This advantage opens up applications far beyond mobile printing.

We have been working with RMPT since the year 2000 and are the pioneers of this game-changing technology.   Right from the early years of development, we could prove that letter-size printing is possible with RMPT: 

It is important to highlight that the PrintBrush XDR CANNOT currently print at full letter-size but it is a step closer to that goal. Our hope is that the Indiegogo community can make the difference.

The PrintBrush XDR can print up to three swaths with a small gap in between each sweep. It is an excellent choice for printing pieces of text and graphics in full color but not yet fully recommended for photos.

 

PrintBrush XDR is one of the first devices featuring RMPT technology. RMPT is the only viable technology path to build truly portable printing devices.

Using advanced software instead of hardware, RMPT opens the way for miniaturization, mechanical simplicity and a lack of electrical motors, thus making it an excellent choice for the environment.

Thanks to the miniature size of the printer, we have created very compact and light packaging. Compared to the packaging of one ordinary desktop printer, we would be able to squeeze in more than 55 packaged units of our printer.

When you consider that over 100 million desktop printers are manufactured every year, our technology has the potential to save hundreds of thousands of tons of steel and plastic, to say nothing of saving huge amounts of energy during manufacturing and usage. Users also have the potential of saving a few trees since they can go paperless and start printing on re-usable substrates such as whiteboards! 

 

As the user slides the PrintBrush XDR across a surface, an optical sensor tracks the velocity and direction of the printer relative to the surface. A controller matches the software interrupts to the relevant columns of the imprint image. 

Thanks to built-in sensors and intelligent software, the imprint will always be correct independently of the direction or the speed of a user’s hand movement. You can go as slow or as fast as you want. You can even stop in the middle of the printout: the PrintBrush XDR delivers accurate and reliable results.

 

The selection of the content to be printed is done through a control App in a smartphone, tablet or a laptop. When selection is ready, just push a print button (choosing single or multiple imprints) on the control App and then move the printer from left to right or right to left over the substrate to be printed.

The device can work as a stand-alone, untethered device if images have been previously uploaded to it. The device is WiFi enabled (No WiFi router needed) and has a USB interface as backup for data connectivity.  

 

INDUSTRIAL DESIGN

 Much attention has been vested into the industrial design of the PrintBrush XDR. Following the Swedish tradition of a minimalist and simplistic design, we eliminated -from the very beginning- the idea of having any superfluous elements. 

The idea was to create a design that fits perfectly into the palm of your hand. The industrial design defined the size of all the internal components. It was a huge challenge, but we are proud to have achieved our goal.

The device is being manufactured in two colors: Black and white, but we will be offering many customization options thanks to a replaceable cover.

 

TESTING

We have carried out an exhaustive test schedule, printing millions of imprints with our pilot units to make sure that they provide the highest possible reliability and quality.

We have even built special machines to carry out automated testing: 

 

MANUFACTURING

Several hundred units of the PrintBrush XDR have already been manufactured in pilot production runs. It means that we have all the production tooling ready. The component supply chain has been secured. Purchase orders for mass production have been given and components are now in stock or on their way to the factory. 

As a backer, you can be assured that you will be getting your chosen reward on time.

 

SHIPPING

Because we are able to ship more than 500 units in a single pallet, we will be bulk shipping to major markets (North America and Europe) so that our backers won't have to worry about custom fees in those regions. Shipping costs are very low due to the low weight and small volume of our device.

 

We recently close a very successful Kickstarter campaign but we still keep receiving everyday inquiries from people that missed the initial campaign in that platform. While we start the deliveries to those initial backers, we are queuing new incoming pre-orders on Indiegogo.

We also want to engage strongly with both communities to help us reach our ultimate goal of developing and industrializing our PrintBrush A4 product concept. This will provide the possibility of printing print letter-sized documents on the fly, challenging and beginning to replace to certain extent, ordinary desktop printers.

All backers that are pledging on a PrintBrush XDR will get a 30% discount on their future pledge for a PrintBrush A4.  

 

PrintDreams has developed several apps to demonstrate the PrintBrush XDR’s flexibility. The company is inviting app vendors to integrate direct printing capabilities into their apps now that the PrintBrush XDR is making on-the-go printing truly mobile. A developer package with SDK for both iOS and Android is available as a reward. A simple- and small Windows Java application is already available. A Linux application too.

iOS App (For Apple's iPhones and iPads)

This app is free of charge and included in the purchase of the PrintBrush XDR. The Graphical User Interface of the iOS app and corresponding libraries are ready and can be experienced here. 

We want the input from our backers before we release our first beta version into the App Store. 

Our partners COLOP have demonstrated their iOS App for the COLOP e-mark, live during the Paperworld show between January 26th -29th 2019 in Frankfurt, Germany.

Android App

A beta release of a demo app is already available for free download on Google Play. Try it here:

 The look and feel is quite different from the iOS version but it allows us to test another usability approach. Eventually we will merge into a version which feels best for our backers and customers. 

This is how the PrintBrush XDR box will look like when you receive it:

When you unpack the box, you will find the printer unit, a pouch with an inkjet cartridge, a 15V power adapter with a plug suitable for your country and a Quick Setup Guide:

It takes less than one minute to make your first imprint:

 

A project that has being on the making as long as ours has required support from many different people and partners.

Initially the development has taken place in our hometown, Stockholm, Sweden. The first prototypes and the industrial design have been done there. 

Looking for more cost-effective product development opportunities, we co-founded a company in Bangalore, India, called Symbolein Technologies. Further hardware and part of firmware development has since been carried out by Unizen Technologies.

 

Since 2009, we have been working with our Austrian partners COLOP, taking the cooperation to a whole new level in the summer of 2017. Together we started the industrialization of the product platform in which the PrintBrush XDR is based, starting a joint venture early 2018.

With COLOP's in-depth knowledge of mechanics and their dedication to product quality, we managed to industrialize a product that we are now proud to offer to our backers.

 

COLOP is launching a similar product called COLOP e-mark which is aimed at the office- and stamp market segments. It was launched during the Paperworld 2019 Fair in Frankfurt, Germany between January 26th to 29th 2019.

The PrintBrush XDR had its first initial public release during GITEX 2018 Expo in Dubai working with our distributor in the region, KTech. The interest from visitors was overwhelming. This encouraged us to launch this Kickstarter campaign and keep working even harder.

 

Following GITEX, we made our official product announcement in London on December 4th 2018, along with our partners COLOP and Hewlett Packard SPS.

Our most recent appearance was during CES 2019 in Las Vegas, Nevada, USA, between January 8th-11th 2019. The stream of visitors and the feedback we got was above all our expectations. Here there are some highlights from the show floor:

Save the planet.The press has called our printer a “Magic Wand for printing” and it is now in pilot production after many years of development.The product features PrintDreams’ RMPT™ technology which puts portable printing capability at the fingertips of smartphone users around the world. The imprints come out directly onto any type of surface with a simple wave of the hand. 
 The PrintBrush XDR is a wireless full color inkjet printer that weighs about the same as an average smartphone but can print larger imprints than its own size.This new versatile device will change the way we think about printing because, for the first time, it is now possible to print anything in full color anywhere, on almost any surface.The imprints are made simply by using a sweeping action, just swapping the printer’s direction from left to right or right to left, directly on any surface, be it paper, cardboard, fabrics, wood, etc.Ordinary printer technology is significantly limited for mobile usage by the fact that printout size is directly linked to device width. RMPT overcomes this limitation by allowing larger printout sizes with smaller hardware. Another advantage is the ability to print directly onto a wide variety of surfaces of varying thicknesses. Mobile users can therefore pick up any paper or material available and use it as print media. This advantage opens up applications far beyond mobile printing.We have been working with RMPT since the year 2000 and are the pioneers of this game-changing technology.   Right from the early years of development, we could prove that letter-size printing is possible with RMPT: It is important to highlight that the PrintBrush XDR CANNOT currently print at full letter-size but it is a step closer to that goal. Our hope is that the Indiegogo community can make the difference.The PrintBrush XDR can print up to three swaths with a small gap in between each sweep. It is an excellent choice for printing pieces of text and graphics in full color but not yet fully recommended for photos. 
 PrintBrush XDR is one of the first devices featuring RMPT technology. RMPT is the only viable technology path to build truly portable printing devices.Using advanced software instead of hardware, RMPT opens the way for miniaturization, mechanical simplicity and a lack of electrical motors, thus making it an excellent choice for the environment.Thanks to the miniature size of the printer, we have created very compact and light packaging. Compared to the packaging of one ordinary desktop printer, we would be able to squeeze in more than 55 packaged units of our printer.When you consider that over 100 million desktop printers are manufactured every year, our technology has the potential to save hundreds of thousands of tons of steel and plastic, to say nothing of saving huge amounts of energy during manufacturing and usage. Users also have the potential of saving a few trees since they can go paperless and start printing on re-usable substrates such as whiteboards!  
 As the user slides the PrintBrush XDR across a surface, an optical sensor tracks the velocity and direction of the printer relative to the surface. A controller matches the software interrupts to the relevant columns of the imprint image. Thanks to built-in sensors and intelligent software, the imprint will always be correct independently of the direction or the speed of a user’s hand movement. You can go as slow or as fast as you want. You can even stop in the middle of the printout: the PrintBrush XDR delivers accurate and reliable results.Exploded view of the PrintBrush XDR The selection of the content to be printed is done through a control App in a smartphone, tablet or a laptop. When selection is ready, just push a print button (choosing single or multiple imprints) on the control App and then move the printer from left to right or right to left over the substrate to be printed.The device can work as a stand-alone, untethered device if images have been previously uploaded to it. The device is WiFi enabled (No WiFi router needed) and has a USB interface as backup for data connectivity.   INDUSTRIAL DESIGN Much attention has been vested into the industrial design of the PrintBrush XDR. Following the Swedish tradition of a minimalist and simplistic design, we eliminated -from the very beginning- the idea of having any superfluous elements. The idea was to create a design that fits perfectly into the palm of your hand. The industrial design defined the size of all the internal components. It was a huge challenge, but we are proud to have achieved our goal.The device is being manufactured in two colors: Black and white, but we will be offering many customization options thanks to a replaceable cover. TESTINGWe have carried out an exhaustive test schedule, printing millions of imprints with our pilot units to make sure that they provide the highest possible reliability and quality.We have even built special machines to carry out automated testing: PrintBrush XDR automated test equipment MANUFACTURINGSeveral hundred units of the PrintBrush XDR have already been manufactured in pilot production runs. It means that we have all the production tooling ready. The component supply chain has been secured. Purchase orders for mass production have been given and components are now in stock or on their way to the factory. As a backer, you can be assured that you will be getting your chosen reward on time. SHIPPINGBecause we are able to ship more than 500 units in a single pallet, we will be bulk shipping to major markets (North America and Europe) so that our backers won't have to worry about custom fees in those regions. Shipping costs are very low due to the low weight and small volume of our device. 
 We recently close a very successful Kickstarter campaign but we still keep receiving everyday inquiries from people that missed the initial campaign in that platform. While we start the deliveries to those initial backers, we are queuing new incoming pre-orders on Indiegogo.We also want to engage strongly with both communities to help us reach our ultimate goal of developing and industrializing our PrintBrush A4 product concept. This will provide the possibility of printing print letter-sized documents on the fly, challenging and beginning to replace to certain extent, ordinary desktop printers.All backers that are pledging on a PrintBrush XDR will get a 30% discount on their future pledge for a PrintBrush A4.   
 
 
 PrintDreams has developed several apps to demonstrate the PrintBrush XDR’s flexibility. The company is inviting app vendors to integrate direct printing capabilities into their apps now that the PrintBrush XDR is making on-the-go printing truly mobile. A developer package with SDK for both iOS and Android is available as a reward. A simple- and small Windows Java application is already available. A Linux application too.iOS App (For Apple's iPhones and iPads)This app is free of charge and included in the purchase of the PrintBrush XDR. The Graphical User Interface of the iOS app and corresponding libraries are ready and can be experienced here. We want the input from our backers before we release our first beta version into the App Store. Our partners COLOP have demonstrated their iOS App for the COLOP e-mark, live during the Paperworld show between January 26th -29th 2019 in Frankfurt, Germany.Android AppA beta release of a demo app is already available for free download on Google Play. Try it here:  The look and feel is quite different from the iOS version but it allows us to test another usability approach. Eventually we will merge into a version which feels best for our backers and customers. 
 
 This is how the PrintBrush XDR box will look like when you receive it:When you unpack the box, you will find the printer unit, a pouch with an inkjet cartridge, a 15V power adapter with a plug suitable for your country and a Quick Setup Guide:PrintBrush XDR items shipped inside the boxIt takes less than one minute to make your first imprint: 
 A project that has being on the making as long as ours has required support from many different people and partners.Initially the development has taken place in our hometown, Stockholm, Sweden. The first prototypes and the industrial design have been done there. Looking for more cost-effective product development opportunities, we co-founded a company in Bangalore, India, called Symbolein Technologies. Further hardware and part of firmware development has since been carried out by Unizen Technologies.Part of technical development team in India Since 2009, we have been working with our Austrian partners COLOP, taking the cooperation to a whole new level in the summer of 2017. Together we started the industrialization of the product platform in which the PrintBrush XDR is based, starting a joint venture early 2018.With COLOP's in-depth knowledge of mechanics and their dedication to product quality, we managed to industrialize a product that we are now proud to offer to our backers.Development & Product team in Austria COLOP is launching a similar product called COLOP e-mark which is aimed at the office- and stamp market segments. It was launched during the Paperworld 2019 Fair in Frankfurt, Germany between January 26th to 29th 2019.The PrintBrush XDR had its first initial public release during GITEX 2018 Expo in Dubai working with our distributor in the region, KTech. The interest from visitors was overwhelming. This encouraged us to launch this Kickstarter campaign and keep working even harder.GITEX 2018 launch in Dubai, UAE, drew a great deal of interest from attendees. Following GITEX, we made our official product announcement in London on December 4th 2018, along with our partners COLOP and Hewlett Packard SPS.Our most recent appearance was during CES 2019 in Las Vegas, Nevada, USA, between January 8th-11th 2019. The stream of visitors and the feedback we got was above all our expectations. Here there are some highlights from the show floor:

story:
Global Launch!

Update:
Over $50,000 raised through private investment!

Brief

   Have to been to an event, club, football game, music festival and wondered where your friends are? Tried to look over the crowd from a chair and nearly fell off? With Crowdsurfer all you do is hold up your phone and you can see exactly where your friends are using your phones camera. Find location, distance from you and even what they're saying via social networks. Never get stranded again and avoid those heated "where are you?!” phone calls. 

This app will be free to download and will change the way people meet and find places. 

What's the money for?

   Crowdsurfer needs your help to finish building this fun and useful app. All the hard work is done in relation to concept, research and design. We just need your help and support to finish this project and release. 
   The money raised will go towards finishing the app, acquiring servers for a speedy global rollout. 

Who will use this and how?

   There are three main functions to this app. Find my friends, find businesses and find locations within events. 

   Friends: 

Enables user to actively find friends in a crowded place or city using the phone in both horizontal (google map style) and vertical (augmented view). You can see their latest posts on social networks and distance from you. Ever tried to find your friends at a music concert? Trying to meet up in the city for a night out with your friends? Parents picking their kids up from school or the shops will be able to find their children wherever they are. Crowdsurfer will make meeting up with the people that matter most easier. 

   Businesses: 
Businesses can advertise their location in both 'map view' and 'augmented view'. Use the speach bubbles to showcase your specials and communicate directly to customers looking for your products in direct proximity to your locations. 
   'Can never find a cash machine when you want one?' 'Can't find that great hole in the wall cafe?' Use the augmented view and see directly where they are. 

   Events:
Search for events in your area and plan your day or night out in advance. Find where all the important stuff is at music festivals, race events and New Years Eve parties like toilets, food stalls, medical help and vantage points. Log in at the event and use 'augmented view' to find them in the real world. Simply hold your phone in front of you and it shows where they are. Simple!

Like us on Facebook:

facebook.com/mycrowdsurfer

story:
Building the World's First Interactive Sign Language Travel App

Our new smartphone app streams short videos so that Deaf travelers have access to public information in their own native sign language.  Check out some screenshots from our beta version available for iOS:

Introducing DeafNationGO

DeafNationGO is the product of a partnership between DeafNation, the international leader in video and social content for the Deaf community, and Artklikk, a mobile development group based in Budapest, Hungary. Our organizations came together because we saw a need and an opportunity - a need for a universal system delivering quality signed content, and an opportunity for us to use our unique resources and skills to make this a reality. Artklikk’s technical know-how combined with DeafNation’s experience with content creation is the perfect recipe for a top notch accessibility solution.

Our goal is for all to enjoy equal access to information and services.

A message from our founders:

How does it work?

Users will open DeafNationGO on any smartphone, search the location-sensitive map, find a public landmark or tourist attraction and learn all about a new place in their preferred sign language. 

All stored content in our database will be accessible via the main menu in the app. You can search the DeafNationGO map for local content, or receive notifications when your phone’s GPS detects you are near a DeafNationGO point of interest. You can choose for content to start streaming automatically or select it manually. You can also access signed content indoors by scanning QR codes next to exhibition pieces, documents, or other tagged items.

 

The next step

We have a proven track record of success and the combined knowledge of how to build great apps and create awesome content. The platform and content management system are ready, and we have a beta version of the smartphone application, built by Artklikk with the help of Deaf developers. We've been piloting the app in a small Deaf community of around 10,000 members, and we have achieved 1,890 downloads in couple of months with limited resources and sign language content. Imagine what could be achieved on a global scale with millions of users and abundant sign language content!

Our next step is to finish the development of the app, update the design to reflect our new partnership with DeafNation, and fill our database with quality and meaningful content.

Our goal is to raise $30,000 in the next 45 days to fund the next round of development and the creation of signed videos for selected landmarks and points of interest. With your help, we will become the go-to place for quality signed content for Deaf tourists and signers worldwide!

How you can help:

If you choose to sponsor a landmark at any level ($100+), you will be directly contributing to our mission to provide quality accessible content for all. To honor that contribution, and as an extra incentive, we will publish YOUR NAME in our app next to the landmark you sponsor. You can also request to be an anonymous donor or dedicate a location to a beneficiary of your choice.

If you aren’t in a position to contribute at this time but support our cause and our project, please help us get the word out and share this campaign with your friends and contacts who might be interested! You can share the link in an email or use any of the social share tools below.

Or, if you have any comments or suggestions for us, we would love to hear from you! Please feel free to reach out to us directly at info@deafnationgo.com.


Suggested Incentives:

Everyone who donates will receive a social media shoutout! Tote bags start at the $25+ level. Check out all of our great perks below:


Global Landmark Suggestions:

story:
8000+ have already backed Phree™ in our crowd funding success! For new backers: Phree is no longer available for preorder. Orders will renew after shipping to backers. Shipping for Indiegogo backers, by waiting list following early adopter backers - not started yet. We deeply appreciate the continuous support of all our backers who've made Phree possible. Knowing you're there pushes us forward throughout our challenging journey into first production - from functional  to manufacturing prototype, to first delivery in November 2016 for developer package backers and beta testing and onward. We're fully committed to getting Phree into your hands.
 

Phree™ is the world’s first unrestricted, high resolution, write-virtually-anywhere mobile input device.

It lets you write, draw, annotate and express yourself in countless other ways. On virtually any surface.
 
 

 Even here. (Yes, here.)

 

And when we say “virtually any surface,” this is just one more example of what we mean.

 

Phree™ will easily connect to all your devices: phone, tablet, laptop, TV…anything with a Bluetooth connection. And Phree is compatible with software and apps like Office, OneNote, EverNote, Acrobat, Google Handwriting Keyboard, Viber and more. So you can instantly sketch or jot down ideas, notes, thoughts, email addresses and phone numbers...whatever crosses your mind!

 

You’ll use Phree in ways you never expected.

 

It even functions as a headset and has an integrated screen for brief texts. When you get one, just write back and send.

 
 

Phree lets you go beyond the screen to express yourself more quickly and easily.

 

Phree in the News

User quotes by people who've tried Phree prototypes in NYC, London, San Francisco, Paris, Berlin, Beijing and Tel Aviv:
 

"I'm surprised and very pleased with the weight and feel of Phree in my hand!"

"Phree seems like a natural extension of the smartphone. Like it's been there all along."
 

How was Phree born?

All of us have amazing dexterity and control over a tool held by our fingers - be it a pen, pencil or scalpel. We learn to exercise this control at such a young age and practice it so often that it becomes truly effortless.
For real-time on-screen digital ink rendering, the latency between our writing motion and the perceived ink trace needs to be an eye-blink – nearly instantaneous – for it to feel “right.” We also want to be able to write and sketch wherever we are and whenever we want to. When you want to jot something down, you don’t want to unlock your phone, open an app and wait.
 

Well, we cracked this.

 
 

At OTM Technologies, we invented our Optical Translation Measurement (OTM) technology that precisely tracks hand motion across virtually any surface, in a wide dynamic range. We managed to engineer and build a compact, low-cost optical sensor that fits at the tip of a pen-like device. The combination of one-of-a-kind, breakthrough technology and ergonomic, user-friendly design brings you Phree.

 

The Design

A lot of thought and prototyping was invested in Phree to ensure a great user experience. It’s thin and it has an oval cross section, so it’s both useful and comfortable. The touch display provides easy activation. Just touch to change from a pen to a highlighter. Or from red to blue. Or from messaging to dialing.
 
 
 
 

The Case

 
 

We designed a functional and practical case to carry and charge Phree. The case has embedded wireless charging - you charge your Phree by simply putting it in its case and placing the case on a wireless charging pad (not included). 

The case cap attaches magnetically to the body of the case to form an adjustable stand for any smartphone. Just place your phone in the stand, begin writing or drawing off-screen with Phree and voilà – you have an instant mobile workstation that actually works. Phree can be ordered with or without a case.
 
 

The Cap

Phree comes with a matching cap that protects it's tip while not in use. The unique rubberized cap doubles as a touch screen stylus in this setup.
 
 

Get your Phree™ as Supply Lasts

  • $198 $249 - GET PHREE - One (1) Phree™
  • $249 $299 - GET PHREE WITH CASE - One (1) Phree™ + Case

*Limited quantity in first production.

*Worldwide shipping is $10 for USA and $20 for the rest of the world.

*Multiple Phree™ units can be ordered by choosing the GET TWO PHREE, GET TWO PHREE WITH CASE, GET THREE PHREE or GET THREE PHREE WITH CASE perks - shipping charges are the same as a single unit shipping.

 

 

 

How does Phree™ work?

The patented OTM sensor is a compact 3D laser interferometer. It tracks the relative motion of a nearby surface by measuring the interference signal between a laser beam projected on the surface and the reflections from the surface. The beauty of this system is that it extracts the motion signal optically.
The signal is then translated to X-Y-Z motion information by our signal-processing algorithms running on a very small, integrated electronics component.
 
 

The OTM sensor can measure the motion of any object that we can see with our eyes, in three dimensions, with extremely high resolution and very high accuracy, up to a distance of about one inch from the object. It therefore continues to measure hand motion between strokes. The sensor uses the same laser used in optical mice and is eye-safe at any distance.

 

Sensor Specs

 
 

Phree Overview

 
 

Phree’s graphical touch-screen is used for Bluetooth connection and context-sensitive interaction with various applications. The standard icons on the display include notifications – messages and phone calls. When used with specific applications the display will change to allow quick interaction with common features. For note taking, for example, the display may show pen, eraser, and highlighter. The touch panel recognizes single fingers and swipe left/right.

An open API allows developers to make use of the screen for specific interaction with their applications. The API provides access to additional sensor information such as vertical (Z) motion data, as well as access to the accelerometer.
 

Phree enhances human interaction in areas such as Augmented Reality (AR) and Virtual Reality (VR), Biometric identification, Gaming, Interactive TV, and more.

Both AR and VR headsets present input challenges that call for creative solutions. Phree offers a unique ability to use the amazing hand-eye coordination we naturally possess to get fine control of objects in the AR/VR world even when we do not look at or see our hand.
 

For Biometric identification, Phree brings the ability to sign and write passwords anywhere, at high resolution, and by adding tracking of the tip motion also between strokes.

 

Team

 
 

Our R&D and design team has vast and varied experience in innovative technology development. We have been working together for more than 10 years and have collaborated with many talented professionals to develop Phree and perfect its technology. It’s been a group effort and we’re grateful for the team members' dedication that's led us this far.

Our experienced OTM team has the know-how and discipline required to deliver Phree into your hands – to take it from prototype to product to production, with the right production partners.
 

Phree - make the world your paper!

 

 

FAQ

Other questions or inquiries? Contact otmtechnologies99@gmail.com

Q: Where is Phree shipped?

A: Phree ships worldwide – everywhere. Limited quantity in first production.
 

Q: Does Phree have pressure sensitivity?

A: Phree’s tip has pressure sensitivity enabling varying width lines in specific applications.
 

Q: How long will the battery last?

A: The battery lasts 2-7 days depending on usage. Full charging time is about one hour. Charging is by USB port on Phree or by external wireless charging pad for Phree with case.
 

Q: How far of a distance from the target device will Phree still work?

A: The Bluetooth® connection works well typically a few meters from the target device.
 

Q: What operating systems, devices and apps are supported by Phree? 

A: Phree supports all major phone, tablet and PC operating systems – Android, iOS, Windows, OSX (Mac), Linux. Phree supports most third party apps on Android, OSX, Windows like Office, OneNote, EverNote, Photoshop, Acrobat, Sketchbook, Google Handwriting Keyboard, Viber, Skitch and more – using the existing interfaces and cursor on the screen. For iOS (like iPhone or iPad) and Android, our app allows users to take quick notes, use Phree as a headset, and display notifications. Currently iOS devices do not show a cursor on their screens and do not support cursor control, so Phree can support only third party iOS apps that interface to Bluetooth® mouse, pen, handwriting recognition keyboard software or specifically interface to Phree.
 

Q: Can one enter text using Phree?

A: Operating systems such as Windows, Apple OSX and Android include handwriting recognition software. We tested Phree with such software by Google, Microsoft, and others and are pleased with the performance. Phree has high resolution to pixel precision with minimal latency for handwriting, sketching, filling forms, annotating and more.
 

Q: Is Phree easy to use for both left and right-handed people?

A: Phree’s design is symmetric for writing and fits both left handed and right handed users, so there is no difference between right- and left-handers when Phree is used together with a device screen, like mobile phone, laptop or tablet – its most frequent use. In the less frequent use of Phree with its built in screen, Phree can be placed on the table to operate the screen. For a quick glance at notifications while writing, the screen lights up indicating a new message so left-handed users can tilt to see it.
 

Q: Can Ink be added?

A: Phree comes with replaceable nibs, but no ink. The idea behind Phree is to provide a complete, real-time digital experience to write, sketch and interact in the digital world. The best interactive digital user experience is when Phree is without Ink. Our user testing shows that Ink interferes and confuses… (having to split-attention between ink in both the physical and digital domains) Digital ink makes it easier to share, organize, collaborate, etc. For paper, you print.
 

Q: Does Phree have a SDK to integrate and develop apps?

A: Phree has an open API that allows developers to make use of its screen for context-sensitive interaction with their applications. The API provides access to additional sensor information such as vertical (Z) motion data, as well as access to the accelerometer. Anyone who has a Phree has access to the open API to develop their apps and software for using with Phree. The API documentation will be published for the use of the community.
 

Q: How to Pre-Order? 

A: To back by pre-ordering your Phree, select your Phree perk: GET PHREE, GET PHREE WITH CASE, GET TWO PHREE, etc. Fill your personal, address, country and credit card details as requested. Submit the form. Get yours while supply lasts...
 

Thanks for supporting Phree!
