The most powerful handheld ever, the appearance design was developed by a German Red Dot Award winning team.

The product supports more than 1,000,000 internet games. Enjoy gaming the second you open the box.
The WIN 2 is equipped with a 6-inch touch screen from Sharp Corporation with a viewing angle up to 178°. The screens area has been increased by 9% compared to the previous generation WIN. It also utilizes In-Cell full lamination technology and fourth generation Corning Gorilla Glass. With a screen resolution of 1280×720, it has a ppi 2.53 times greater than that of a typical 24-Inch desktop monitor. The WIN 2 also has a capacitive touch screen.
Featuring a seventh generation Intel® Kaby Lake Core™ m3-7Y30 processor, with performance close to that of the Intel® Core™ i7-3770K. With its CPU-Z single-core performance score of 1244 points, there is no stutter running the latest AAA-class games when using low game effects.
Complimenting the m3-7y30 CPU cores, the m3-7y30 also features 9th generation Intel® HD Graphics 615 with 24 EU execution units and a maximum dynamic frequency of 900MHz. Game frame rates have increased by a factor of 2.2 times compared to the previous generation GPD WIN. Games are smoother and looks more realistic.
The device features a M.2 2242 port, with extremely high read/write speed capability. Game loading is 4 times faster compared to a mechanical hard disk or eMMC.
Equipped with 2×4900mAh large-capacity and high-density polymer lithium batteries. The GPD WIN 2 has a maximum game play battery-life of over 6 hours. Our product is also the first game handheld to support PD 2.0 fast charge, allowing the battery to be charged to half full within 45 minutes.
Brand new gamepad design with two 3D joysticks from ALPS Japan, featuring built-in dual-vibration motors to ensure that you get immersed in the game. You can sense even the slightest vibration with unparalleled comfort during gameplay.
Designed with an innovative PC-class cooling solution, It features a high-power turbofan which can adjust rpm dynamically from 2000 to 8800rpm. When the temperature of the CPU core is between 20 ℃~80 ℃, the 60-speed dynamic temperature control will kick in to best balance efficiency
WIN 2 can be charged through mobile power based on PD 2.0 or PD 3.0. At the same time, WIN 2 can also provide the power for your mobile device, such as mobile phone.
For a long time, we have thought about how to best design our handhelds in an ergonomic, aesthetic and commercially valued way.We are pleased to announce that the design of the GPD WIN 2 has been done in cooperation between GPD and the Red Dot Award winning design team. We feel the design of the WIN 2 has achieved the best balance of aesthetics, engineering and ergonomics.The frame of the lid is made of light, strong magnesium alloy material to prevent the screen bending. The rounded edge design shows more affinity. The black removable ABS cover can be replaced with other zinc alloy cover. Alternatively, you can also decorate it with your own metal or adhesive stickers. Enjoy personalizing the style of your GPD WIN 2 to your taste.To keep the WIN 2 lightweight, the main body of the WIN 2 uses ABS material. The sunken design of the joysticks allows seamless access to the other game controls. Unique arc metallic film keys, which make it more suitable for blind operation. The 360 style ABXY buttons, still use screen print double-character for their labels. The machine body, keyboard and gamepad use colors which bring out the best of the design. With an elegant matt UV finish, it provides the user with a delicate feel. The machine has been artistically designed with a fine balance of colors and material application.The trigger keys: L1/L2/L3, R1/R2/R3 are situated at the back of the WIN 2 near both corners. The interface ports are also on the back and comprise of: Type C USB, 3.5mm headphone, USB 3.0, Micro SD card slot, Micro HDMI. The hot air outlet is also situated at the rear. The quite compact layout, brings out the best of the design.The bottom surface of the WIN 2 has been designed with a covered slot to enable easy user replacement of the M.2 SSD card. The M.2 SSD card is fixed in place using screws, which effectively guarantees that the SSD is connected with the M.2 interface, even when the WIN 2 is shaken or in the extreme drop state.The design of the air inlet on the side of previous WIN model makes it easier for them to be blocked by hands when holding the machine, which has been widely criticized. This time around, the air inlet of the WIN 2 has been designed in the bottom surface. The fan then forces hot air out the back of the machine. Hot air only travels a short distance before it exits via the back vent, extracting heat from the machine in nearly no time. In limited tests, the temperature of the machine can be controlled at about 39 degrees.Equipped with a 6-inch Super-Shine screen from Sharp Corporation, the viewing area has increased by 9% compared to the previous generation. Using In-Cell full lamination technology, the screen is thinner due to the reduction of a piece of glass. By applying the fourth generation of Corning Gorilla Glass, the intact rate of a 1-meter drop test is as high as 80%, and damage reduction shows a 45% improvement compared to Gorilla Glass 3. Protective design with no prominent frame, allows you to focus on your gaming. Side and upper screen borders have been kept to a minimum, with an upper border of only 5mm and a lower border of only 3mm. The screen resolution is 1280×720, it has a PPI 2.53 times greater than that of a typical 24-Inch desktop monitor. The viewing angle is up to 178°. The WIN 2 also has a capacitive touch screen.Equipped with the seventh generation ultra-low voltage Intel® Kaby Lake Core™ m3-7Y30 Processor, fabricated using advanced 14nm technology. Under the same power consumption, it can deliver about 12% performance improvement compared to the previous generation Skylake technology. The bus speed of Intel® Core™ m3-7Y30 can reach 99.76MHz, with OPI bus speeds up to 4GT/s and peak data transfer of 4×10^9 times. Together with 4MB L3 cache, it greatly reduces the time to retrieve data from memory.Due to the increased number of transistors and architecture optimizations, the m3-7Y30 is significantly better than the x7-Z8750 used in the previous generation GPD WIN. The improvement in the measured performance of the m3-7y30 is quite obvious. The CPU-Z single-core performance reaches 1244 points, almost 4 times that of the x7-Z8750. Multi-core performance reaches 2688 points, 2 times that of the Z8750. The overall performance is close to the third generation Intel i7-3770K.The emergency response speed of the m3-7y30 has increased significantly thanks to Speed Shift technology which can instantly boost CPU Turbo. Compared to the 0.1 second response time of the m3-6y30, the response time of the m3-7y30 is only 0.005 seconds, killing nearly all the stutters in team battles.Utilizing 9th generation Intel® HD Graphics 615 with 24 execution units (EUs) and a maximum dynamic frequency of 900MHz, the WIN 2 graphics performance surpasses that of its predecessor which uses Intel’s 8th generation HD Graphics 405, with only 16 EUs and a maximum dynamic frequency of only 600MHz.When parallel processing graphics data in a high throughput situation, the HD Graphics 615 performance is up to 220% better than the discrete graphics NVIDIA GeForce GT240. Coupled with the fact that the system resolution is not that high, the WIN 2 can easily cope with the latest AAA games when using low game effects.* AIDA64 scores denote the sum of the Read, Write, Copy score. Only PCmark Vantage represents the score of the memory.The m3-7y30 only supports LPDDR3 which has a maximum operating frequency of 1866MHz. Compared to the previous generation of Z8750, the memory frequency has increased by 1.17 times. With dual-channel design, bandwidth up to 128bits, the effective wait time is reduced by 50%, enabling games to run more smoothly. RAM increases to 8GB which is twice as that of previous generation WIN.* The tested SSD is Transcend / Transcend TS512GMTS400 512GB. Continuous read/write testing is based on CrystalDiskMark for performance evaluation, and the random read and write testing uses CrystalDiskMark QD32 for performance evaluation.The WIN 2 features an M.2 2242 socket interface. It comes standard with a 128GB M.2 SSD. The SSD adopts SATA 3.0 based on the AHCI protocol, which has a theoretical bandwidth of up to 6Gb/s, and a theoretical transfer speed of up to 600MB/s.The M.2 SSD can be easily replaced. Players can buy 256GB, 512GB or higher capacity SSD to replace the original one. There is no capacity limit, which means it can store more games, videos and applications.As an example of SSDs speed, we tested the read speed of the Transcend TS512GMTS400 512GB SSD (which is not the standard SSD in the WIN 2). Read speeds for this card reach 560MB/s, and write speeds reach 460MB/s. This hardware configuration design enables the machine to reach the optimal overall performance of the system, there is no system configuration bottleneck.At the player’s request, the WIN 2 retains the Micro SD card slot. The m3-7y30 supports UHS 104 ultra-high-speed SD interface, and the bus bandwidth is up to 104MB/s, which perfectly supports Micro SDXC cards.* The Micro SD card used in the test is SAMSUNG 128GB (model number: MB-MC128D); test software: ATTO Disk Benchmarks V2.47.We performed a speed test using the SAMSUNG 128GB (Model: MB-MC128D) USD card on the WIN 2. The tests showed read speeds up to 86MB/s, and write speeds up to 55MB/s. These results are 2.04 times better than achieved on the previous generation WIN console, taking full advantage of its bandwidth. The price advantage of Micro SD is quite obvious compared to SSD, and the read/write speed is not lower than that of eMMC. The Micro SD is therefore a powerful complement to the WIN 2 storage options.The following table is based on the current situation of the maximum capacity of storage devices on the market, from which we can calculate that the maximum scalable storage capacity of GPD WIN 2 is 2.912TB:* The above products are the maximum capacity that can be obtained in mainland China, but it does not mean that there is not larger capacity options in other regions. As long as it complies with the interface specification, our GPD WIN 2 can also support the storage.Set the mode switch to X to enter the Xbox 360 gamepad mode. The gamepad still remains the style of WIN, using Japanese ALPS double-3D joystick, with the sunk-style design, which is improved to reduce operational errors.On the left side is a classic cross style D-Pad, which enables fast and accurate directional movement. On the right is the Xbox 360 style action buttons, labeled using a screen print double-character, faster and more accurate with finger touch.L3/R3 trigger buttons are located on the back of the WIN 2 together with L1/R1 and L2/R2. The newly designed trigger buttons make it easy for players to reach the buttons quickly, making the overall gaming experience better.WIN 2 is also equipped with two vibration motors. It’s insane level of vibration effect will help you get more immersed in the game. The two vibrating motors are extremely powerful, providing you with an unsurpassed experience in both racing and shooting games. Each game has a unique and appropriate vibration mode. When playing shooting games, you can feel the recoil of the gun pushing you backward; when starting a car engine, you can feel the vibration of the engine as if you were really sitting in the car. Even the slightest vibration can be sensed, making you more immersed in the game than ever before.The WIN 2 keyboard has been designed to cope with more than 1 million key presses. Key travel has been set to avoid fatigue from long typing sessions. The keyboard has an excellent feel. THE WASD, left, right, up and down keys are designed in a protruding style, which makes PC keyboard gaming easier. The concave power button has been designed to avoid inadvertent presses. In the upper right corner of the keyboard, there is the Xbox key, which can serve as “home button”, “screenshot button” etc.When the mode switch is set to the mouse mode, WIN 2 will simulate a mouse using the joystick.Mouse control is important for PC games, as such, the WIN 2 joystick can be used to simulate a mouse. Also, in order to meet the needs of different players, the mouse speed can be increased by pressing the L2 button. If you need faster mouse movement speed, you can press the L2 button to increase the mouse speed by a factor of 2.In order to extend the battery-life, WIN 2 uses 2×4900mAh large-capacity and high-density polymer lithium batteries, with 7.6V output, 37.24Wh of power and 600Wh/L energy density. Its battery capacity is increased by 49% compared to the previous generation WIN, the battery’s power delivery efficiency has been increased from 82% to 95%. The large batteries enable the WIN 2 to deliver an outstanding gaming battery life of over 6 hours. At the same time, our product is also the first game handheld to support PD 2.0 fast charge which can charge the battery to half full within 45 minutes.In addition, the charging logic of the WIN 2 has been changed. When in charging mode, the motherboard is directly powered by the source supply rather than through the battery. The WIN 2 can support a maximum power supply of 12V/2A. When the power supplied by the charger is not enough to fully power the WIN 2, the battery will supply the power needed in order to ensure better performance and longer runtime of the WIN 2.To enhance the cooling effect, the WIN 2 is designed with a PC-class cooling solution utilizing a high-power turbofan. The fan has a dynamic speed ranging from 2000 to 8800rpm. With large-volume side-blown thermal outlet design and ultra-short outlet distance, the hot air exhaust performance is 8 times greater than that of the previous generation WIN.At the same time, the WIN 2 increases the TDP of 4.5W to 15W. When the temperature of the CPU is between 20 ℃~80 ℃, the 60-speed dynamic temperature control will be started by BIOS to optimally balance the energy/performance ratio.As for the design of the internal structure, it has benefited from changing the L-type motherboard, to a dual motherboard superposition design. The saved room is used to store the double battery stack, which effectively prevents the conduction of heat between the battery and motherboard.WIN 2 can be charged through mobile power based on PD 2.0 or PD 3.0. At the same time, WIN 2 can also provide the power for your mobile device, such as mobile phone. In theory, it can charge 6.8 times to iPhone 5, 5 times to iPhone 7, 3.6 times to iPhone X and 1.5 times to iPad Mini.

We were committed to build a portable device that can run a large number of retro games using emulators, and thus we launched the GPD XD. The XD was very successful and has been widely loved by PSP, NDS and arcade gamers.Later, we found that there were many games on the Windows platform, but there was no handheld console that could support these games. So we launched the GPD WIN. The introduction of this PC gaming handheld was a sensation both locally and abroad, though it is not perfect.The introduction of the WIN has laid the foundation for us to launch the WIN 2. The WIN 2 makes up for many deficiencies of our first product and has made a major breakthrough in terms of performance, heat dissipation, appearance, ergonomics and other aspects of the system.The reason why this crowdfunding was launched on Indiegogo, was mainly due to the high cost of: R&D, molds and materials. All the money we raise will go into volume production of this product. We believe that this product will thrill all players who love handheld gaming and it will be handheld PC gamer’s first choice for years to come. We sincerely hope that you can support this project. Let’s work together to make the GPD WIN 2 a reality.We are a company focused on handheld gaming products and office equipment based in Shenzhen, China. GPD is our brand, our full name is Gamepad Digital. GPD is committed to providing users with personalized products and services.To begin with, we thank all gamers who join in this crowdfunding campaign. It is your continuous support that makes our products better. Without your trust and support, there would be no mass production or market launch of this product.1. GPD WIN 2 game test videohttps://www.youtube.com/user/ThePhawx/videoshttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpnDsmgMnCn0XZvGIM9yrXg/videos2. Does the price includes tax tariffs for international buyer?The price includes international courier freight and surcharges to remote areas, but it does not include the import tax tariff generated when for the destination country. Generally, the tariff generated when reaching EU countries is 21% and about 10% to Japan. Parcels entering the United States with a value over $800, may also incur a tariff. The tariffs may be even higher to other countries.3. What after-sales service are crowdfunding participants entitled to?Crowdfunding participants have the same warranty rights as the product users who purchase the product after launch. If you are dissatisfied with the product, you can return it within one week of receipt of the goods, but the refund will deduct the shipping costs you initialy paid for the product.Please note that the postage and packaging charges incurred during the return of product will be your own responsibility. When mailing the product, the local postal delivery is preferred because other international logistics will generate tariff which is equal to 20% to 30% of the product value when entering China, GPD will not bear this the cost.4. What if the crowdfunding does not reach the target amount?If crowdfunding does not reach the target amount, Indiegogo shall refund all backers. At the same time, we will look for other financing channels to ensure the smooth development of R&D and production. We sincerely hope that all players who love this handheld can continue to follow the latest progress of the project.5. Dear Japanese backers, please note:Please write down your address in Japanese in order to avoid translation mistake causing failure delivery. Thank you.  お客様の住所は日本語で記入していただけませんか？ご協力ありがとうございます。6. If my question is not promptly answered, what should I do?If your question is not promptly answered, please refer to the following contact information:
During crowdfunding process, for technical questions, please send your email to: kendyzhu777@softwincn.com
After the crowdfunding, for product delivery progress, please send your email to: sales01@gpd.hk
After receiving the product, for quality problems or return, please send your email to: kendyz@gpd.hk
For distribution or agency issues, please send your email to: kendyzhu77@softwincn.com
When sending emails to us, please make sure to use the email address that you used for your purchase on Indiegogo, our staff will then reply to you as soon as possible.

Indiegogo supporters will be rewarded first.
Product specifications may change during the crowdfunding process to ensure the product is made as best as possible. If any specifications are changed, we will notify everyone in the “Update” section of the crowdfunding page.
The product will provide CE-RoHS, FCC, CCC, JATE, MIC and other international certification.
We will try our best to meet our targeted release timing. However, due to supply chain, quality control or other issues may arise which can cause delays to the delivery of the product. We hope to have your understanding in those circumstances.

story:
Short Summary

I am going to be totally honest.  I really want a Lamborghini Gallardo because I think they are the coolest super cars on the planet.  I dont have the money to get one but if anyone will help me get one that would be pretty cool.

What I Need 

I need at least $100,000 to get a Lamborghini Gallardo. I just need 100,000 people to donate 1 dollar each. If I do not reach the goal I will still buy a cool car.  

The Impact

The impact it would have on my life would be amazing.  I would probably be breathless.  Everybody has told me this is crazy but ive always heard the saying you have to start somewhere.  To be successful in life you have to set goals and try.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell everyone you know that has a bit of extra money they could give to me so I can be one of the happiest 18 year olds on earth.

story:
Screenscene Mount® is designed to give you more to view, wherever your adventures may take you. Plus, you can always attach TWO devices. It's an extension to your productivity, relaxation, or however you choose to use it! 

✅Super Easy and Quick to Set up

✅With Three Points of Contact, Your Screens Will Stay in Place

✅Works with Most Laptops, Tablets, and Phones

✅No Magnets, Adhesives, or Metal Plates to Add to the Back of Your Devices

✅Designed for Displays with Small Edge Bezels, So You See More Screen Real Estate

✅Perfect for Work From Home Warriors

✅Light, Portable, and Fun!

USEFUL PRETTY MUCH...ANYWHERE!

And yes, Screenscene Mount is super portable, and fits easily into all types of bags, purses, and cases. It's also extremely light, weighing in at just over three ounces!

REVERSING SIDES IS EASY.

Screenscene Mount uses simple elastic tension to hold your devices in place. No need for magnets or adhesives, and no spacer inserts to compensate for multiple device widths. And with the Tablet + Phone Kit, just flip the top band to reverse what side your devices are on.

Shop while checking social media (while working), listen to music while monitoring stocks (again, while working)...you get the idea. So many scenarios, so little time! Or maybe you might save some time...

SHARE YOUR LAPTOP SCREEN WITH YOUR TABLET.

Use third party apps and screen sharing integration to make your laptop feel more like a multi-monitor desktop, and boost productivity wherever you go.

You probably own a perfectly good, high resolution monitor in your tablet device, so why invest in another external monitor for an extended workspace experience? With Screenscene Mount, you don't have to. WFH warriors rejoice!

*With the Tablet + Tablet Kit, attach the top mount to your device,

and then let it hang...

PERKS

LET'S GET TECHNICAL

THE STORY

Hello! This is Glenn, the designer of Screenscene Mount®. Just to give you a little background, Screenscene Mount was created out of frustration, the desire to get more done, and the need to stream a few TV shows on the side...literally!

PROTOTYPE Version .00224.53 (Almost There)

First of all, the vast majority of us use a laptop as our main computer. Useful for accomplishing important tasks, typing emails, designing, and creating. Versatile, light, and portable. What more could one want…?

OK, let’s face it, there may be one small downfall...you can only do so much with the screen space on a laptop before it starts to feel cramped! With multiple programs filling up your screen, you’re always taking time to move around windows to get that perfect layout. And if that doesn’t happen, command + tab (or alt + tab) becomes a standard way of life.

A 3D Prototype Ready for a Test Print!

And so the thought came up...maybe just buy another portable monitor to make some additional screen real estate? As somewhat of a minimalist, one would definitely question the purchase. But then the thought..how could someone use the devices they already own in order to solve this dilemma? Wouldn’t it be super nice to have a tablet and phone, front and center to the laptop, in order to work, play, and stay connected, all in one place?

And so the journey to develop an easy to use, lightweight screen mount (that you could take anywhere) began.

A Little Closer...

Over the past year and a half, time was spent collaborating with additional designers, artists, and engineers, designing and 3D printing several prototypes, testing materials, tweaking, and prototyping even more. In time we finally came up with a mount that would be super versatile, light, and extremely useful.

Plastic Injection Molded Sample!

In short, Screenscene Mount is a product that has taken lots of thought, hard work, collaboration, and determination to get to where it's at now. It takes the devices you already own, and gives them new use and functionality, while boosting productivity, relaxation, and maybe even some fun!

Thanks for taking time to check it out and read this story. We are excited to present Screenscene Mount, and hope that this product will benefit you and enhance your work, home, and mobile lifestyle!

THE TIMELINE TO GET HERE, and BEYOND...

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We have already built the tooling for producing the plastic injection molded parts, and have sourced the additional components to assemble the product. The contributions made will go toward the first production run of the injection molded parts and the additional materials.

As part of the original design, we have been testing self adhesive textured rubber or felt grip pads to ensure the best strength and security when attached to devices (as 3D printed prototypes perform differently than injection molded plastic). We are also currently testing a few different types of plastics materials to see if they alone provide the desired tactile grip we are looking for. If they don’t meet our requirements, we may also ship along two sets of precision laser cut grip pads. These can easily be attached to the inside surface of Screenscene Mount for additional surface grip.

One of the most challenging aspects of Screenscene Mount's production may be the assembly phase. However, the manufacturer also provides assembly and packaging services, so most all of the logistics have been thought of and covered.

Besides any unforeseen circumstances, we plan to ship as scheduled, but of course will inform you along the way if we come across any bumps in the road!

OTHER WAYS TO HELP OUT

Thanks for getting this far on the page! If you find you are unable to contribute, or Screenscene Mount® just isn't for you, we would appreciate and love for you to share this page with friends, family and co-workers who you think may be interested!

Besides any unforeseen circumstances, we plan to ship as scheduled, but of course will inform you along the way if we come across any bumps in the road!
OTHER WAYS TO HELP OUT
Thanks for getting this far on the page! If you find you are unable to contribute, or Screenscene Mount® just isn't for you, we would appreciate and love for you to share this page with friends, family and co-workers who you think may be interested!

story:
PERFIKIO EXCHANGE

(Derived from the Latin perficiō for Achieve)


 “Buy Stock In A Person - Sell Stock In Yourself! ”

This is a ground breaking idea that will revolutionize investing for the people.

It’s about REGULAR PEOPLE INVESTING IN REGULAR PEOPLE!

It's one part social media, one part crowdfunding and one part investing. 

STAND OUT FROM THE CROWD.

                                 


Simply post your profile and describe who you are and what makes you different from other people. Let people know your strengths, goals and achievements. You can upload photos, videos and anything else that helps people understand who you are and why they should invest in you.

Offer a limited amount of your stock for sale at an introductory price and then market yourself, achieve your goals and prove to people you are worthy of your price. If you can prove you're different and you can stand out from the crowd, people will notice and they will invest. 



              The Big Idea (It's not about money)

Regardless of how much money someone makes in their lives, if they have accomplished something spectacular or noteworthy, they draw attention to themselves. Therefore drawing attention to investors in a market specifically designed for you to take part in their accomplishments. 

How does it work?

Perfikio Excange will be a worldwide, web based stock market that allows users to buy and sell stock in an individual. At launch, in addition to allowing individuals to buy and sell stock, Perfikio Exchange will include two of the most popular sports worldwide with the most loyal fans of all time. Soccer and Formula 1. Every major world team will be represented as well as the individual players/drivers.



·  An IPO (Initial Public Offering) will be offered at an introductory price with a limited amount of stock available for each team and each player/driver.

·  As demand increases and the available stock is sold out, the price increases through trading between members.

The price of these stocks is performance driven. As a team or player excels, the price will increase thereby allowing investors to sell the stock at a profit should they choose to do so. 


As the company gains recognition and grows, other sports/players  will be added to the site for investment. Private individuals will always be able to be added and traded on the market. If a person had a profile created before they became professional, their account will remain as an individual even though they are a member of a team represented on Perfikio Exchange.

Where Does The Money Go?  This is the best part!

The initial pool of money generated by the IPOs of teams and players will go to charity. Several charities will be offered for members to choose from. Teams and player’s proceeds will always go to charity. 

 Individual people have the choice of keeping the proceeds of stock sales for themselves or donate to proceeds to a charity of their choice. 

Why We Need Your Help

Ground breaking ideas are always more difficult to get off the ground than simply reinventing an existing product. It’s not impossible, just challenging. It’s only a matter of finding our way through the obstacles in place to make this vision a reality. With your help, a team of attorneys and consultants will find the way. This is why we’re here. We need your help to fund this first round of capital in order to hire the best in this field.

This has been a dream of mine for years and now is the time to make it happen. I'm Gavin Smith.  I've run several successful companies over the years. The most important thing I've learned in business is in order to make something work, you need to hire the most highly qualified people in their field in order to reach your goals. I have consultants and attorneys lined up to hit the ground running on this but they require money. They are not cheap. This first round of funding will be used to fund the building of the framework and foundation for this endeavour. This is possibly the most important step. Without the proper feasible foundation in place, We will never get the next round of funding where we will assemble a management team of professionals. From there we will be able to attract a top venture capital firm that will take this vision to market.   

We need your help right now. Perfikio Exchange is revolutionary. This company has the ability to go where no other for profit company has gone before.  Where else can you invest wisely and make money while at the same time, creating a worldwide pool to help charities who help so many people in need?   

Donate now and let's see how far we can take this idea!

story:
Pour le français, cliquez ici ou défilez

Thanks to all our fans, Wireless Thymio is now available on our shop www.mobsya.org/shop.


Grâce aux contributions de nos fans, Wireless Thymio est maintenant disponible sur notre site internet www.mobsya.org/shop

What is this crowdfunding for?

Thymio is an educational robot already used worldwide by private users and schools. Children can play with it and program it. From now on, a new feature is available: Thymio can be programmed wirelessly. No more constraining USB cable! And good news, it is compatible with the current version of Thymio*. The development is almost finished. With your help, we can start the production of the Wireless Thymio.
*(if you bought it after May 2012)

AS SEEN ON

Robohub - "Within about ten minutes, I was able to modify one of the basic starter functions that allows the ThymioII to turn away from objects in front of it "

IEEE spectrum - "Thymio is a great first robot for kids: designed by roboticists and educators... it’s mobile, colorful, easy to program, has tons of online support and continual development "

CNET - "Thymio has a very deep continualy developping community "

Gizmag - " [...] Now, there is a piece of EPFL-developed technology that you can get your hands on [...] "

Table of content

What is a Wireless Thymio?
What can I do with a Wireless Thymio?
How does it work?
Your perks
Testimonies
Technical specifications
Who we are
FAQ

What is a Wireless Thymio?

  • It is an evolution of the Thymio robot which is already used by tens of thousands of children
  • You can now leave the robot on the playground while you program it
  • You can visualise Thymio’s internal state at any time
  • Six pre-programmed behaviours so even five-year-old children can play with it
  • A visual programming language to develop logical and inventive thinking
  • A textual programming language to code like an engineer
  • Numerous activities available on-line for free to unleash your creativity

Wireless Thymio is a classic Thymio in which a small electronic module is soldered. This module is connected wirelessly to a USB dongle plugged into your computer. It simply replace the USB cable. This new feature is compatible with the current version of Thymio*
*(if you bought it after May 2012)

What can I do with a Wireless Thymio?

Are you tired of seeing your kids using a computer only to play crazy games online? With Thymio, your kids will continue to play and have fun but they will unconsciously learn the fundamentals of technology, computing and programming.
Why is it so important? Because our world is filled with technology and understanding it will be fundamental for their future.
Thymio is a colourful robot which comes with numerous sensors. This little robot will boost your children's creativity!
How to use it? Get it out of the box and play with its pre-programmed behaviours. Make it interact with other toys and let your children create their new universe.

You will finally have a great time with your kids and a technological device. Thymio is the best way to learn more about our digital world. The visual programming language is so intuitive that even with no knowledge about it, you will be able to help your children discovering technology.

and if you want something more challenging try the textual programming language!

That's not all. You will find tutorials and activities ideas for free on Thymio’s website: www.thymio.org!

How does it work?

As soon as you receive your Thymio, you can play with it! Just press the central button and discover its six pre-programmed behaviours.
If you want to program your robot it is really easy. When you receive it you only need to download Aseba on thymio.org, plug the dongle into your computer and program it.

Your perks

Wireless Thymio

The perfect way to start with Thymio!
You receive a new Wireless Thymio and its dongle. You can start programming right away!

Wireless Thymio Expert Pack

With this pack, you get everything you need to program your Thymio!
The pack includes a Wireless Thymio and its dongle, a discovery poster including a printed poster and instructions, a remote control, a wall charger, an SD card, and a card reader.

We upgrade your Thymio!

You have a Thymio and you are sick of the USB cable?
We can transform it into a Wireless Thymio! Just send it to us and we will upgrade it for you. You will get it back with a dongle, ready to program it wirelessly! This is only available for Thymio bought after April 2012.

DIY upgrade kit

Only for experimented users with knowledge of electronics - you might damage your robot!
You have an Thymio and you're sick of the USB cable?
This extension lets you upgrade your Thymio to make it Wireless! You will receive a module with instructions on how to solder it into your Thymio, as well as a dongle for your computer. This is only available for Thymio bought after April 2012.

Thank you!

Thank you for supporting our project!
Your help means a lot to us. To show our appreciation, you will receive our special Tips & Tricks pdf on what to do with your Thymio per e-mail!

Wall charger (EU plug)

Recharge easily!
This charger makes it more convenient and faster to recharge your Thymio! The plug of this charger is European (type C).

SD card & USB card reader

A great addition to your learning experience with Thymio!
You will get a micro SD card for your Thymio, and a card reader for your computer. With these accessories, you can use more elaborate sounds and record data!

Discovery poster & remote control

Now that your Thymio is wandering freely, you cannot keep running after it to press the buttons!
With this remote control and a discovery poster including a printed poster and an instructions sheet, your learning space expands!

Wireless Thymio Suitcase

Enjoy Thymio with your friends!
This suitcase contains 6 Wireless Thymio with their dongles, and a multiple USB charger.
Especially convenient for schools and clubs!

VIP Pack

Wow! We are extremely grateful for your contribution!
You will get everything from the Expert Pack, plus a very special present from Thymio itself: Thymio will create a new personalized light painting video with your name!
The video will be uploaded to youtube, and you will receive the source code and the track (pdf and printed) to reproduce it at home.

Testimonies

Which low-cost robots would you recommend?
“My favourite is the brilliant EPFL designed Thymio”
Alan Winfield
Professor of Electronic Engineering, UWE Bristol
Director of the UWE Science Communication Unit
University of the West of England, Bristol
Via Twitter

Le Thymio II, conçu par l’École polytechnique fédéral de Lausanne, est un excellent choix pour mener des activités robotiques avec des élèves, particulièrement de primaire. Facile à utiliser, disposant de deux modes de programmation (visuel et textuel), il est très complet. Nous le conseillons avec beaucoup d’enthousiasme !
Flowers Lab, INRIA, Bordeaux

For two years I have been developing learning materials and carrying out pedagogical research on the Thymio robot in collaboration with people from Mobsya. In my opinion, the Thymio robot and its Aseba software environment are the best systems for educational robotics. The robot is robust and inexpensive, yet equipped with more sensors than other, more expensive, educational robots. The software is based upon an advanced computer-science concept, yet the visual programming language is simple for young students to understand. I fully support this spin-fund request.
Mordechai (Moti) Ben-Ari, Ph.D.
Full Professor
Department of Science Teaching
Weizmann Institute of Science
Rehovot, Israel

Thymio is a great first robot for kids: designed by roboticists and educators at EPFL in Switzerland, it’s mobile, colorful, easy to program, has tons of online support and continual development
Evan Ackerman
Blogger on IEEE Spectrum

Technical specifications

Thymio has many sensors, several actuators and various human-robot interface modalities. Wireless Thymio will have the same core capabilities, sensors and actuators. The difference is the new radio module and USB dongle that will make it programmable wirelessly.

Programming language and environment

Thymio and Wireless Thymio can be programmed with Aseba. Aseba is a set of tools designed to give access to programming to the general public. It is an open-source software composed of VPL and Aseba Studio.

VPL (for Visual Programming Language) has been designed especially to program Thymio in an easy way thanks to events and actions blocks. No text, just images.

Aseba Studio has been designed to program robots such as Thymio through text. It allows a deeper level of control and complexity than VPL.

Additionnal information

  • Dimensions: 11cm x 11cm x 5.5cm
  • Weight: 250 grammes
  • Build-in lithium polymer battery (3.6V, 1'500mAh). Rechargeable through USB. Mean usage time: 2 hours. Charge time: 2 hours.
  • Max speed: 15 cm/s
  • Inter-Thymio communication through the proximity sensors
  • Radio module: IEEE 802.15.4, 2.4GHz

Who we are

Mobsya is a nonprofit association. It manages the production and distribution of the Thymio robot. Mobsya is the entity managing this crowdfunding. The goal of our association is to promote education to technology through robotics. To reach this goal, Mobsya coordinates different projects surrounding Thymio and wants to federate the efforts made by its partners in order to create the best concept of education to technology.

Christophe Barraud
CEO
Obtained a Master degree in robotics from EPFL in February 2013. He began at Mobsya association developing mecatronic components for a research robot and became president in August 2014. He is working in different robotics and education projects.
Prof. Dr. Francesco Mondada
Academic coordinator
Professor of robotics at École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lauranne, initiator of the Thymio project. He aims at bringing the best robotics research results into educational products.
Mariza Freire
Head of communication
Obtained a Master degree of Arts in 2009. Co-founder and member of Mobsya, she is highly experienced in promoting science and technology for non-specialists. She is working on developing communication around educational robots.
Dr. Stéphane Magnenat
CS education research
Postdoc at Disney Research Zürich, co-founder and board member of Mobsya. He got his PhD from EPFL in 2010, then worked at ETH Zürich. He created Aseba, and co-created VPL. His research focus on mobile robotics, CS education, and visual computing.
Dr. Fanny Riedo
Head of industrialization
Co-creator of Thymio. She specialises in small mobile robots for education and obtained a doctorate in robotics at EPFL in 2015 for her research with Thymio. She works mainly at bringing robots and documentation to production, so that everybody can access them.
Dr. Michael Bonani
CTO
Obtained a doctorate in robotics from EPFL in 2010. Co-creator of Thymio, board member of Mobsya, he works on this project since its beginning and brings his expertise in mecha-tronic design of mobile robots.

FAQ

What age group is Thymio intended for?

Thymio can be interesting for a very wide age range! Children as young as 5 can discover robotics through play, for example using the discovery kit with the help of an adult. Visual programming is great for beginners of all ages, although before 10 some children might not be comfortable with using a computer and mouse by themselves. Textual programming is accessible from teenagers to adults.

Is Wireless Thymio compatible with Wi-fi or Bluetooth?

No, Wireless Thymio is not compatible neither with Wi-fi, nor with Bluetooth. The wireless communication between the computer and Thymio is established through a radio frequency module inside the robot, and a dongle plugged into the USB socket of the computer.

Do I need a USB dongle to program a Wireless Thymio?

Yes, it is absolutely mandatory if you want to beneficiate of the Wireless capabilities. If you do not have a USB dongle plugged to your computer, you will not be able to connect to Wireless Thymio. Although, you will still be able to program Wireless Thymio with a USB cable.

Do I need a classic Thymio to get a Wireless Thymio?

No, you can directly buy a Wireless Thymio, it is the 150 EUR perk. You will then receive a new Wireless Thymio (already equipped with its module) and a USB dongle to plug into your computer.

I have an old Thymio; can it be upgraded to Wireless Thymio?

If your robot was bought after April 2012, yes. You can buy the 70 EUR perk, send your robot to us, and we’ll upgrade it for you! If you are experienced with a soldering iron and like to do things yourself, you can also buy the 60 EUR perk, and you’ll get a kit to upgrade it yourself.
An easy way to know if your robot is upgradeable: look underneath, between the wheels, if “design by epfl / écal” is written.

Pre 2012 Thymio : NOT upgradeable

design epfl / écal / mobsya written between the wheels
Post-2012 Thymio : upgradeable

no inscription between the wheels

Can I upgrade my Thymio on my own?

It is possible, but it is not simple. This procedure should be done only by people already familiar with electronics and experienced with a soldering iron. Indeed, you will have to open Thymio and solder the four pins of the module inside. Be careful, this procedure can damage the robot if it is not done properly.

When will you ship the perks?

Please be assured that you will receive your perks as soon as possible, at the latest in November. The development is already well advanced; the campaign aims primarily at financing the tooling, first batch, and certification. We already have experience in producing robots and we will keep you updated; you will not have unpleasant surprises!

How does the upgrade happen?

You send us you Thymio robot, we fix it, you get it back! You should send it to us before end of August 2015, and you’ll be sure to have it back in November! If you miss the deadline, no worries; we’ll upgrade it as soon as possible. We just cannot give you a precise date in that case!

I forgot to add the shipping costs / made a mistake in the price. How can I fix this?

It can happen, don´t worry! Before shipping the perks we will contact each contributor to verify their address and give them instructions on how to pay for the shipping if it has not been done already!

My shipping address is not correct, can I change it?

Yes, you can! Before shipping the perks, we will contact each contributor to verify their address.

Return to the top

Pour nos contributeurs francophones

Pourquoi un crowdfunding ?

Thymio est un robot éducatif déjà utilisé dans le monde entier par le grand public et les écoles avec lequel les enfants peuvent jouer et le programmer. Une nouvelle fonctionnalité a été développée : Thymio peut être programmé sans fil. Plus besoin du câble USB qui gêne ! Et bonne nouvelle, cette amélioration est compatible avec la version actuelle de Thymio*. Le développement est presque terminé et avec votre aide, nous pourrons démarrer la production des Wireless Thymio.
*(si vous l'avez acheté après avril 2012)

VU SUR

Robohub - "Within about ten minutes, I was able to modify one of the basic starter functions that allows the ThymioII to turn away from objects in front of it "

IEEE spectrum - "Thymio is a great first robot for kids: designed by roboticists and educators... it’s mobile, colorful, easy to program, has tons of online support and continual development "

CNET - "Thymio has a very deep continualy developping community "

Gizmag - " [...] Now, there is a piece of EPFL-developed technology that you can get your hands on [...] "

Table des matières

Qu'est-ce qu'un Wireless Thymio ?
Que puis-je faire avec un Wireless Thymio ?
Comment ça marche ?
Vos contreparties
Témoignages
Spécifications techniques
Qui sommes-nous ?
FAQ

Qu'est-ce qu'un Wireless Thymio ?

  • C'est une évolution du robot Thymio déjà utilisé par des dizaines de miliers d'enfants
  • Vous pouvez désormais laisser le robot où il est pour le programmer
  • Vous pouvez visualiser l'état interne de Thymio à tout moment
  • Six comportements pré-programmés pour que les enfants dès cinq ans puissent jouer avec
  • Un langage de programmation visuel pour développer la logique et l’inventivité
  • Un langage de programmation textuel pour coder comme un-e ingénieur-e
  • De nombreuses activités disponibles en ligne et gratuites pour lâcher la bride à votre créativité

Wireless Thymio est un Thymio classique dans lequel un petit module électronique est soudé. Ce module est connecté par radio à un dongle USB branché à votre ordinateur. Il remplace simplement le câble USB. Cette nouvelle fonctionnalité est compatible avec la version actuelle de Thymio.*
*(si vous l'avez acheté après mai 2012)

Que puis-je faire avec un Wireless Thymio ?

En avez-vous assez de voir vos enfants utiliser un ordinateur simplement pour jouer à des jeux en ligne ? Avec Thymio, vos enfants continueront à jouer et à s'amuser mais ils vont inconsciemment découvrir les bases du fonctionnement de la technologie et de la programmation.
Pourquoi est-ce si important ? Parce la technologie est toujours plus présente dans notre quotidien et que la comprendre et la maîtriser sera fondamental pour l’avenir de nos enfants.
Thymio est un robot plein de couleurs munis de nombreux capteurs. Ce petit robot va stimuler la créativité de vos enfants !
Comment fonctionne-t-il ? Sortez-le de sa boîte et jouez avec ses comportements pré-programmés. Faites-le interagir avec d'autres jouets et laisser vos enfants se créer un nouvel univers.

Avec cet outil technologique, vous passerez enfin des moments de qualité avec vos enfants. Thymio est la meilleure façon d'appréhender notre monde digital. Son langage de programmation visuel est tellement intuitif que même sans rien connaître à l’informatique vous pourrez aider vos enfants à découvrir la technologie.

et si vous voulez quelque chose de plus ambitieux, essayez le langage de programmation texte !

Ce n'est pas tout. Vous trouverez des tutoriaux et des idées d'activités gratuitement sur le site web de Thymio: www.thymio.org!

Comment ça marche ?

Dès que vous recevez votre Thymio, vous pouvez jouer avec ! Pressez simplement son bouton central et découvrez ses six comportements pré-programmés.
Si vous voulez le programmer, rien de plus simple. Il suffit de télécharger Aseba sur thymio.org et de l'installer, de brancher le dongle USB à votre ordinateur et vous pouvez commencer à le programmer !

Vos contreparties

Wireless Thymio

La meilleure façon de démarrer avec Thymio!
Vous recevez un Wireless Thymio et son dongle; vous êtes prêt à programmer !

Pack Expert Wireless Thymio

Dans ce pack spécial, vous recevez tout ce dont vous pourriez avoir besoin pour programmer Thymio !
Ce pack contient un Wireless Thymio et son dongle, une piste découverte incluant un poster et une fiche d'instructions, une télécommande, un chargeur mural, une carte micro SD et un lecteur de carte SD.

Nous mettons votre Thymio à jour !

Vous avez un ancien Thymio et vous en avez marre du câble USB?
Nous pouvons le transformer en Wireless Thymio ! Envoyez-nous simplement votre robot et vous récupérerez un Wireless Thymio avec son dongle, prêt à être programmé ! Ceci n'est valable que pour les Thymio achetés après avril 2012.

Module Wireless et Dongle

Seulement pour les utilisateurs expérimentés connaissant l'électronique - possibilité d'endomager définitivement votre robot!
Vous avez un ancien Thymio et vous en avez marre du câble USB? Cette extension vous permet de mettre à jour votre Thymio pour en faire un Wirless Thymio! Vous recevrez un module à souder dans le Thymio et les instructions pour le faire, ainsi qu'un dongle pour votre ordinateur. Ceci n'est valable que pour les Thymio achetés après avril 2012.

Merci !

Merci pour votre soutien!
Votre aide compte beaucoup pour nous. Pour vous remercier, vous recevrez nos Trucs et Astuces avec Thymio sous forme pdf par e-mail!

Chargeur mural (prise EU)

Avec ce chargeur mural, il est plus pratique et rapide de recharger votre Thymio! La prise est de type européenne (type C).

Carte SD & lecteur de carte USB

Une super addition à votre expérience d'apprentissage avec Thymio!
Vous recevrez une carte micro SD ainsi qu'un lecteur de carte USB pour votre ordinateur. Grâce à ces accessoires, vous pourrez utiliser plus de sons pour Thymio ou enregistrer des données !

Piste découverte & Télécommande

Maintenant que votre Thymio peut se promener librement, vous n'allez pas lui courir après pour appuyer sur ses boutons!
Avec cette télécommande accompagnée d'une piste découverte (incluant un poster et une fiche d'instructions), votre terrain de jeu s'élargit!

Valise Wireless Thymio

Cette valise contient 6 Wireless Thymio et un chargeur USB multiple - spécialement pratique pour les écoles ou les clubs!

Pack VIP

Ouaouh! Nous sommes émerveillés de votre générosité !
Vous recevrez tout ce qu'il y a dans le Pack expert, plus un cadeau très spécial de la part de Thymio: un light-painting représentant votre prénom ! Une vidéo du light-painting sera téléchargée sur youtube, et vous recevrez le code source et la piste correspondante pour le refaire chez vous !

Témoignages

Which low-cost robots would you recommend?
“My favourite is the brilliant EPFL designed Thymio”
Alan Winfield
Professor of Electronic Engineering, UWE Bristol
Director of the UWE Science Communication Unit
University of the West of England, Bristol
Via Twitter

Le Thymio II, conçu par l’École polytechnique fédéral de Lausanne, est un excellent choix pour mener des activités robotiques avec des élèves, particulièrement de primaire. Facile à utiliser, disposant de deux modes de programmation (visuel et textuel), il est très complet. Nous le conseillons avec beaucoup d’enthousiasme !
Flowers Lab, INRIA, Bordeaux

For two years I have been developing learning materials and carrying out pedagogical research on the Thymio robot in collaboration with people from Mobsya. In my opinion, the Thymio robot and its Aseba software environment are the best systems for educational robotics. The robot is robust and inexpensive, yet equipped with more sensors than other, more expensive, educational robots. The software is based upon an advanced computer-science concept, yet the visual programming language is simple for young students to understand. I fully support this spin-fund request.
Mordechai (Moti) Ben-Ari, Ph.D.
Full Professor
Department of Science Teaching
Weizmann Institute of Science
Rehovot, Israel

Thymio is a great first robot for kids: designed by roboticists and educators at EPFL in Switzerland, it’s mobile, colorful, easy to program, has tons of online support and continual development
Evan Ackerman
Blogger on IEEE Spectrum

Spécifications techniques

Thymio possède de nombreux capteurs, plusieurs actuateurs et différentes interfaces homme-robot. Le Wireless Thymio possédera les mêmes capacités de base, les mêmes capteurs et les mêmes actuateurs. La différence vient de son nouveau module radio permettant de le programmer sans fil.

Langage de programmation et environnement

Thymio et Wireless Thymio peuvent être programmés grâce à Aseba. Aseba est un set d'outils conçus pour permettre l'accès à la programmation au grand public. C'est un logiciel open-source composé de VPL et d'Aseba Studio.

VPL (pour Visual Programming Language) a été conçu spécifiquement pour programmer Thymio d'une façon simple grâce à des blocs événement et action. Pas de texte, juste des images.

Aseba Studio a été conçu pour programmer des robots comme le Thymio avec du texte. Cela permet un niveau de contrôle et de complexité plus grand que VPL.

Informations supplémentaires

  • Dimensions: 11cm x 11cm x 5.5cm
  • Poids: 250 grammes
  • Batterie lithium polymer (3.6V, 1'500mAh). Rechargeable par USB. Temps d'utilisation moyen: 2 heures. Temps de charge: 2 heures.
  • Vitesse max: 15 cm/s
  • Communication inter-Thymio par les capteurs de proximité
  • Module radio: IEEE 802.15.4, 2.4GHz

Qui sommes-nous ?

Mobsya est une association à but non-lucratif. Elle gère la production et la distribution des robots Thymio. Elle est l’entité qui gère ce crowdfunding. La vocation de Mobsya est de promouvoir l’éducation à la technologie grâce à la robotique. Afin de remplir sa mission, Mobsya coordonne les différents projets autour de Thymio et souhaite fédérer les nombreux efforts des partenaires dans le but de créér le meilleur concept pour l’éducation à la technologie.

Christophe Barraud
CEO
A obtenu un Master en robotique de l'EPFL en février 2013. Il a commencé à Mobsya pour développer des composents mécatroniques pour un robot de recherche et est devenu président en Août 2014. Il travaille dans divers projets de robotique éducative
Prof. Dr. Francesco Mondada
Coordinateur académique
Professeur de robotique à l'École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lauranne, initiateur du projet Thymio. Son but est à d'amener les meilleurs projets de recherche en robotique au publique en les transformant en produits éducatifs.
Mariza Freire
Responsable communication
A obtenu un Master en Lettres en 2009. Co-fondatrice et membre de Mobsya, elle a une grande expérience dans la promotion des sciences pour les non-initiés. Elle travaille au développement de la communication autour de robots éducatifs.
Dr. Stéphane Magnenat
Recherche en éducation aux sciences numériques
Postdoc chez Disney Research Zürich, co-fondateur et membre du comité de Mobsya. Il a obtenu un doctorat de l'EPFL en 2010 et a travaillé à l'ETH Zürich. Créateur d'Aseba et co-créateur de VPL. Il travaille dans la recherche en robotique mobile et en éducation aux sciences numériques.
Dr. Fanny Riedo
Responsalbe industrialisation
Co-créatrice de Thymio. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la robotique mobile pour l'éducation et a obtenu un doctorat en robotique de l'EPFL en 2015 pour ses recherches sur Thymio. Elle travaille principalement à la mise en production de robots et de documentation pour en faire profiter le grand public.
Dr. Michael Bonani
CTO
A obtenu un doctorat en robotique à l'EPFL en 2010. Co-createur de Thymio et membre du comité de Mobsya, il travaille sur le projet Thymio depuis ses débuts et y amène son expertise en design méca-tronique de robots mobiles.

FAQ

À quel âge peut-on utiliser Thymio ?

Thymio peut être utilisé à tout âge ! Des enfants de 5 ans peuvent découvrir les robots en jouant avec ses modes de base ou en utilisant un poster découverte avec l'aide d'un adulte. La programmation visuelle est un excellent outil pour découvrir la programmation dès 6 ans, bien qu'avant 10 ans, certains enfants peuvent avoir besoin de l'aide d'un adulte pour utiliser l'ordinateur ou la souris. La programmation texte est accessible pour les jeunes, adolescents et adultes.

Wireless Thymio est-il compatible avec le Wi-fi ou le Bluetooth ?

Non, Wireless Thymio n'est ni compatible avec le Wi-fi, ni avec le Bluetooth. La communication sans fil entre un ordinateur et Wireless Thymio est établie grâce à un module radio dans le robot et à un dongle USB connecté à un ordinateur.

Ai-je besoin d'un dongle USB pour programmer Wireless Thymio ?

Oui, c'est absolument obligatoire si vous voulez profiter de la programmation sans fil. Si vous n'avez pas de dongle USB, votre ordinateur ne pourra pas se connecter à un Wireless Thymio. Malgré tout, vous pourrez toujours programmer un Wireless Thymio avec un câble USB.

Ai-je besoin d'un Thymio classique pour avoir un Wireless Thymio ?

Non, vous pouvez directement acheter un Wireless Thymio, il s'agit de la contrepartie à 150 EUR. Vous recevrez alors un nouveau Wireless Thymio (déjà équipé d'un module) et un dongle USB à brancher à votre ordinateur.

J'ai un Thymio; peut-il être transformé en Wireless Thymio ?

Si vous avez acheté votre robot après avril 2012, oui. Vous pouvez acheter la contrepartie à 70 EUR, nous envoyer votre robot et nous le transformerons pour vous ! Si vous avez une bonne expérience avec un fer à souder et si vous voudriez le faire vous-même, vous pouvez acheter la contrepartie à 60 EUR, vous recevrez un kit pour le transformer vous-même.
Un moyen simple de savoir si votre robot peut être transformer est de regarder dessous, entre les roues. S'il y a une inscription "design by epfl / écal", alors c'est qu'il n'est PAS transformable.

Thymio avant 2012 : PAS transformable

"design epfl / écal / mobsya" écris entre les roues
Thymio après 2012 : transformable

Pas d'inscription entre les roues

Puis-je transformer mon Thymio moi-même ?

C'est possible mais ce n'est pas simple. Cette procédure ne doit être faite que si vous êtes familier avec l'électronique et si vous avez de l'expérience avec un fer à souder. Vous devrez ouvrir Thymio et souder les quatre pins du module radio à l'intérieur. Attention, cette procédure, si elle est mal réalisée, peut endommager votre robot.

Quand mes contreparties seront-elles livrées ?

Soyez assurés que vos contreparties seront envoyées dès que possible, au plus tard en novembre. Le développement est bien avancé, cette campagne de crowdfunding vise premièrement à financer la première production et la certification des robots. Nous avons déjà de l'expérience en production de robot à grande échelle et vous tiendrons au courant de l'évolution de la production. Vous n'aurez pas de mauvaises surprises !

Comment la transformation de mon robot s'effectuera ?

Vous nous envoyez votre Thymio, nous lui ajoutons le module et mettons un dongle USB dans sa boîte et vous le recevez en retour ! Vous devrez envoyer votre robot avant la fin du mois d'août 2015 pour être sûr de le recevoir en novembre ! Si vous rater cette échéance, pas de problème, votre robot sera transformé au plus vite ! Nous ne pourrons par contre pas vous garantir qu'il sera de retour pour novembre dans ce cas.

J'ai oublié d'ajouter des frais d'envois / J'ai fait une erreur dans le prix. Comment puis-je arranger ça ?

Cela peut arriver, pas de panique ! Avant de livrer vos contreparties, nous contacterons chaque contributeur par mail pour vérifier votre adresse et vous donner des instructions sur comment payer les frais d'envoi si ce n'est pas déjà fait!

Mon adresse de livraison n'est pas correcte, puis-je la changer ?

Oui, bien sûr ! Avant de livrer vos contreparties, nous vous contacterons tous individuellement pour vérifier votre adresse.

Retourner en haut de la partie française

Retourner tout en haut de la page

What is a Wireless Thymio?

It is an evolution of the Thymio robot which is already used by tens of thousands of children
You can now leave the robot on the playground while you program it
You can visualise Thymio’s internal state at any time 
Six pre-programmed behaviours so even five-year-old children can play with it
A visual programming language to develop logical and inventive thinking
A textual programming language to code like an engineer
Numerous activities available on-line for free to unleash your creativity




Wireless Thymio is a classic Thymio in which a small electronic module is soldered. This module is connected wirelessly to a USB dongle plugged into your computer. It simply replace the USB cable. This new feature is compatible with the current version of Thymio*
*(if you bought it after May 2012)

What can I do with a Wireless Thymio?
Are you tired of seeing your kids using a computer only to play crazy games online? With Thymio, your kids will continue to play and have fun but they will unconsciously learn the fundamentals of technology, computing and programming.
Why is it so important? Because our world is filled with technology and understanding it will be fundamental for their future.
Thymio is a colourful robot which comes with numerous sensors. This little robot will boost your children's creativity!
How to use it? Get it out of the box and play with its pre-programmed behaviours. Make it interact with other toys and let your children create their new universe.








You will finally have a great time with your kids and a technological device. Thymio is the best way to learn more about our digital world. 
The visual programming language is so intuitive that even with no knowledge about it, you will be able to help your children discovering technology.

and if you want something more challenging try the textual programming language!

That's not all. You will find tutorials and activities ideas for free on Thymio’s website: www.thymio.org!


How does it work?

As soon as you receive your Thymio, you can play with it! Just press the central button and discover its six pre-programmed behaviours.
If you want to program your robot it is really easy. When you receive it you only need to download Aseba on thymio.org, plug the dongle into your computer and program it. 

Your perks












Wireless Thymio
The perfect way to start with Thymio! 
	You receive a new Wireless Thymio and its dongle. You can start programming right away!


Wireless Thymio Expert Pack
With this pack, you get everything you need to program your Thymio! 
	The pack includes a Wireless Thymio and its dongle, a discovery poster including a printed poster and instructions, a remote control, a wall charger, an SD card, and a card reader.












We upgrade your Thymio!
You have a Thymio and you are sick of the USB cable? 
We can transform it into a Wireless Thymio! Just send it to us and we will upgrade it for you. You will get it back with a dongle, ready to program it wirelessly! This is only available for Thymio bought after April 2012.
	


DIY upgrade kit
Only for experimented users with knowledge of electronics - you might damage your robot! 
You have an Thymio and you're sick of the USB cable? 
This extension lets you upgrade your Thymio to make it Wireless! You will receive a module with instructions on how to solder it into your Thymio, as well as a dongle for your computer. This is only available for Thymio bought after April 2012.
	












Thank you!
Thank you for supporting our project! 
Your help means a lot to us. To show our appreciation, you will receive our special Tips & Tricks pdf on what to do with your Thymio per e-mail!
	


Wall charger (EU plug)
Recharge easily!
This charger makes it more convenient and faster to recharge your Thymio! The plug of this charger is European (type C).
	












SD card & USB card reader
A great addition to your learning experience with Thymio! 
You will get a micro SD card for your Thymio, and a card reader for your computer. With these accessories, you can use more elaborate sounds and record data!
	


Discovery poster & remote control
Now that your Thymio is wandering freely, you cannot keep running after it to press the buttons! 
With this remote control and a discovery poster including a printed poster and an instructions sheet, your learning space expands!
	












Wireless Thymio Suitcase
Enjoy Thymio with your friends!
This suitcase contains 6 Wireless Thymio with their dongles, and a multiple USB charger. 
Especially convenient for schools and clubs!
	


VIP Pack
Wow! We are extremely grateful for your contribution!
You will get everything from the Expert Pack, plus a very special present from Thymio itself: Thymio will create a new personalized light painting video with your name! 
The video will be uploaded to youtube, and you will receive the source code and the track (pdf and printed) to reproduce it at home.

Technical specifications


Thymio has many sensors, several actuators and various human-robot interface modalities. Wireless Thymio will have the same core capabilities, sensors and actuators. The difference is the new radio module and USB dongle that will make it programmable wirelessly.

Programming language and environment
Thymio and Wireless Thymio can be programmed with Aseba. Aseba is a set of tools designed to give access to programming to the general public. It is an open-source software composed of VPL and Aseba Studio.




VPL (for Visual Programming Language) has been designed especially to program Thymio in an easy way thanks to events and actions blocks. No text, just images.



 

Aseba Studio has been designed to program robots such as Thymio through text. It allows a deeper level of control and complexity than VPL.




Additionnal information

Dimensions: 11cm x 11cm x 5.5cm
Weight: 250 grammes
Build-in lithium polymer battery (3.6V, 1'500mAh). Rechargeable through USB. Mean usage time: 2 hours. Charge time: 2 hours.
Max speed: 15 cm/s
Inter-Thymio communication through the proximity sensors
Radio module: IEEE 802.15.4, 2.4GHz


Who we are

Mobsya is a nonprofit association. It manages the production and distribution of the Thymio robot. Mobsya is the entity managing this crowdfunding. The goal of our association is to promote education to technology through robotics. To reach this goal, Mobsya coordinates different projects surrounding Thymio and wants to federate the efforts made by its partners in order to create the best concept of education to technology.






Christophe Barraud 
CEO 
	Obtained a Master degree in robotics from EPFL in February 2013. He began at Mobsya association developing mecatronic components for a research robot and became president in August 2014. He is working in different robotics and education projects. 
	




Prof. Dr. Francesco Mondada 
Academic coordinator 
	Professor of robotics at École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lauranne, initiator of the Thymio project. He aims at bringing the best robotics research results into educational products.
	




Mariza Freire 
Head of communication 
	Obtained a Master degree of Arts in 2009. Co-founder and member of Mobsya, she is highly experienced in promoting science and technology for non-specialists. She is working on developing communication around educational robots.
	




Dr. Stéphane Magnenat 
CS education research 
	Postdoc at Disney Research Zürich, co-founder and board member of Mobsya. He got his PhD from EPFL in 2010, then worked at ETH Zürich. He created Aseba, and co-created VPL. His research focus on mobile robotics, CS education, and visual computing. 
	




Dr. Fanny Riedo 
Head of industrialization 
	Co-creator of Thymio. She specialises in small mobile robots for education and obtained a doctorate in robotics at EPFL in 2015 for her research with Thymio. She works mainly at bringing robots and documentation to production, so that everybody can access them. 
	




Dr. Michael Bonani 
CTO 
	Obtained a doctorate in robotics from EPFL in 2010. Co-creator of Thymio, board member of Mobsya, he works on this project since its beginning and brings his expertise in mecha-tronic design of mobile robots.
	




FAQ
What age group is Thymio intended for?
Thymio can be interesting for a very wide age range! Children as young as 5 can discover robotics through play, for example using the discovery kit with the help of an adult. Visual programming is great for beginners of all ages, although before 10 some children might not be comfortable with using a computer and mouse by themselves. Textual programming is accessible from teenagers to adults.
Is Wireless Thymio compatible with Wi-fi or Bluetooth?
No, Wireless Thymio is not compatible neither with Wi-fi, nor with Bluetooth. The wireless communication between the computer and Thymio is established through a radio frequency module inside the robot, and a dongle plugged into the USB socket of the computer. 
Do I need a USB dongle to program a Wireless Thymio?
Yes, it is absolutely mandatory if you want to beneficiate of the Wireless capabilities. If you do not have a USB dongle plugged to your computer, you will not be able to connect to Wireless Thymio. Although, you will still be able to program Wireless Thymio with a USB cable. 
Do I need a classic Thymio to get a Wireless Thymio?
No, you can directly buy a Wireless Thymio, it is the 150 EUR perk. You will then receive a new Wireless Thymio (already equipped with its module) and a USB dongle to plug into your computer.
I have an old Thymio; can it be upgraded to Wireless Thymio?
If your robot was bought after April 2012, yes. You can buy the 70 EUR perk, send your robot to us, and we’ll upgrade it for you! If you are experienced with a soldering iron and like to do things yourself, you can also buy the 60 EUR perk, and you’ll get a kit to upgrade it yourself.
An easy way to know if your robot is upgradeable: look underneath, between the wheels, if “design by epfl / écal” is written.












Pre 2012 Thymio : NOT upgradeable
design epfl / écal / mobsya written between the wheels


Post-2012 Thymio : upgradeable
no inscription between the wheels




Can I upgrade my Thymio on my own?
It is possible, but it is not simple. This procedure should be done only by people already familiar with electronics and experienced with a soldering iron. Indeed, you will have to open Thymio and solder the four pins of the module inside. Be careful, this procedure can damage the robot if it is not done properly.
When will you ship the perks? 
Please be assured that you will receive your perks as soon as possible, at the latest in November. The development is already well advanced; the campaign aims primarily at financing the tooling, first batch, and certification. We already have experience in producing robots and we will keep you updated; you will not have unpleasant surprises!
How does the upgrade happen?
You send us you Thymio robot, we fix it, you get it back! You should send it to us before end of August 2015, and you’ll be sure to have it back in November! If you miss the deadline, no worries; we’ll upgrade it as soon as possible. We just cannot give you a precise date in that case!
I forgot to add the shipping costs / made a mistake in the price. How can I fix this?
It can happen, don´t worry! Before shipping the perks we will contact each contributor to verify their address and give them instructions on how to pay for the shipping if it has not been done already!
My shipping address is not correct, can I change it?
Yes, you can! Before shipping the perks, we will contact each contributor to verify their address.

Qu'est-ce qu'un Wireless Thymio ?

Wireless Thymio est un Thymio classique dans lequel un petit module électronique est soudé. Ce module est connecté par radio à un dongle USB branché à votre ordinateur. Il remplace simplement le câble USB. Cette nouvelle fonctionnalité est compatible avec la version actuelle de Thymio.*

Que puis-je faire avec un Wireless Thymio ?
En avez-vous assez de voir vos enfants utiliser un ordinateur simplement pour jouer à des jeux en ligne ? Avec Thymio, vos enfants continueront à jouer et à s'amuser mais ils vont inconsciemment découvrir les bases du fonctionnement de la technologie et de la programmation.
Pourquoi est-ce si important ? Parce la technologie est toujours plus présente dans notre quotidien et que la comprendre et la maîtriser sera fondamental pour l’avenir de nos enfants.
Thymio est un robot plein de couleurs munis de nombreux capteurs. Ce petit robot va stimuler la créativité de vos enfants !
Comment fonctionne-t-il ? Sortez-le de sa boîte et jouez avec ses comportements pré-programmés. Faites-le interagir avec d'autres jouets et laisser vos enfants se créer un nouvel univers.








Avec cet outil technologique, vous passerez enfin des moments de qualité avec vos enfants. Thymio est la meilleure façon d'appréhender notre monde digital. Son langage de programmation visuel est tellement intuitif que même sans rien connaître à l’informatique vous pourrez aider vos enfants à découvrir la technologie.

et si vous voulez quelque chose de plus ambitieux, essayez le langage de programmation texte !

Ce n'est pas tout. Vous trouverez des tutoriaux et des idées d'activités gratuitement sur le site web de Thymio: www.thymio.org!


Comment ça marche ?
